title: Head of IT Operations
description:
At NOBA, you’ll shape a modern tech environment, work with the latest cloud technologies, and play a central role in our journey. If you thrive in dynamic settings where delivery, structure and innovation go hand-in-hand - this is your next step.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As Head of IT Operations, you’ll be responsible for one of NOBA’s most critical areas - the stability, efficiency, and scalability of our tech platform. You’ll lead two teams and several specialists across infrastructure, workplace, support, incident management, applications and IT projects, ensuring that our tech foundation is robust, secure, and support our growth.
   

  

 This is a senior and hands-on leadership role where you combine operational excellence with long-term planning and strategic decision-making. You’ll work closely with leaders across Tech and the business, driving improvements, maturing processes, and accelerating our cloud journey.
   

  

**Main Responsibilities**
* Lead and develop the IT Operations organization (23 colleagues, including five direct reports), covering Infrastructure, IT Support, Application Management, IT Projects, and Incident Management.
* Mature roles, processes, workflows, and contribute to strategic decisions as part of the Product & Tech management team.
* Oversee NOBA’s cloud environments (Azure) as well as the IT Workplace (devices, tooling, identity and authentication).
* Ensure effective IT support operations and manage recurring activities such as ICT controls, access management, and formal reporting.
* Govern and drive the performance of external system providers within your domain.
* Track, report, and improve key risk, control, and performance metrics across the domain.
* Drive adoption of new technologies, including cloud capabilities, automation, and AI, to improve efficiency and delivery speed.


 Some travels is required to our Oslo or Stockholm office depending on your location.
   

  

**We’re Looking For You Who Have**
* Extensive experience in IT Operations, including infrastructure, cloud operations, IT workplace and service management - with a solid understanding of how to run critical environments where stability, compliance and speed must co-exist.
* Strong leadership experience, preferably leading leaders, with a proven ability to set direction, build trust and drive accountability.
* Background from a regulated industry such as banking, financial services, telecom, government, or similar.
* Cloud experience (Azure, AWS or GCP): you don’t need to be a hands-on specialist, but you can challenge, guide and make sound decisions.
* Fluent communication skills in Swedish or Norwegian, and English.


**It’s a Plus If You Experience In**
 Experience in organizational integrations, AI or automation initiatives, budget responsibility for large IT domains, identity & access management, workplace services, or relevant technical education.
   

  

**To thrive and perform well in the role, we believe that you need to be:**
 Structured, results-oriented and motivated by leading through others. You communicate clearly, build trust quickly and enjoy balancing operational hands-on work with long-term planning. You thrive in environments where change is constant, and you bring the resilience, drive and curiosity needed to move things forward.
   

  

**Have you heard of NOBAVERSE?**
 In our NOBAVERSE, we value openness, trust, and diversity. Here, you can influence your own development and have fun along the way to achieving our goals – all in a workplace that’s a little extra
 *bubbly* 
 ! ✨
   

  

 Read more about our employee value proposition on our careers page.
   

  

**Read more about how our recruitment process works in the** 
**FAQ** 
**.**
 We care for your privacy and, with reference to the GDPR, would like to ask you not to include any sensitive personal data in your application, for examples information about ethnic origin, political opinions, religious beliefs or information about your health.
   

  

**Read more about how we handle your personal data** 
**here** 
**.**
 If you have any questions or concerns about the position, please contact the responsible recruiter Sarah Wahlstedt Corméry at sarah.wahlstedt.cormery@nordax.se .
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application! 🙏✨

title: Digital Designer
description:
**Digital designer (UI/visual)**
 At Above, you’ll bring bold ideas to life for some of the world’s most exciting brands, diving into a mix of daring projects alongside creative minds from every corner of the industry. We are a warm, multidisciplinary team that thrives on pushing the boundaries of digital design — supported by expert coaches, caring leaders, and a feedback-driven culture where everyone grows together.
   

  

 Once here, you will be an integral part of our design team, and have the opportunity to proactively contribute to all stages of the design process, from research to visual concepts, from design explorations to crafting compelling experiences.
   

  

**About Us**
 We believe in changing behaviors for the better, make businesses flourish, and help people in their everyday lives. And most importantly, having fun doing so. We believe in work-life balance and flexibility. We know that creativity needs to be free to flourish.
   

  

 We share a fundamental passion for innovation and design. Through our curiosity we build deeper relationships with people, industries and problems around us. Our designs are never better than our understanding of the problem we’re trying to solve.
   

  

 We are collaborators and believe that effective teams achieve world class results. Prestige is left at the doorstep.
   

  

**About You**
 We are looking for a self-starter who loves teaming up with creative minds from all disciplines, turning big ideas into even bigger results. You see challenges as opportunities, always focused on finding smart solutions that make a real impact for clients and colleagues alike. Your commitment shines through in everything you do  . You bring positive energy, spreading good vibes and a service-minded spirit wherever you go. As a true ambassador for Above, you represent us with professionalism and pride—inside and outside the studio.
   

  

**Bullet lists are hard to love, we know. You don’t have to check all of them, but it’s great if you recognize yourself in the general theme below**
* You’ve got a bachelor’s degree in visual design (or something equally awesome).
* You bring 3–5 years of visual/UI design experience, with a passion for both classic and quirky digital touchpoints — think websites and apps but also business dashboards or even EV charger screens.
* You have an eye for detail and you’re passionate about making visual design that stands out, moves the user and pushes the limits.
* You have an ability to turn business requirements, goals, and user needs into design solutions.
* You can explain and document your process, present your work and communicate your decisions.
* You have proficiency in relevant tools such as Figma.
* You’re used to the high paced agency life and love working closely with all kinds of clients.
* Bonus points if you’re skilled in design systems or motion design.
* You’re fluent in English (and if you speak Swedish, that’s a cherry on top—but not a dealbreaker!).


**A few things to keep in mind**
* Be sure to include both your CV and a portfolio that shows off your design skills.
* This role is based in Stockholm, and we love seeing each other in person — either at our inspiring office or with clients. If you’re not in Stockholm yet but ready to make the move, let us know!
* Sorry, freelancers—this one’s for future full-time Above crew only.


 We’re on the hunt for several talented designers and will keep applications open until we’ve found our dream team. If you haven’t heard from us yet, don’t worry—you’re still in the running!

title: Senior Networking and automation Consultant
description:
**Senior nätverks- och automationskonsult till Telia Cygate** 
  
 



  
 



 Hallå där! Vill du jobba med det senaste inom nätverk? Vill du vara med och forma framtidens nätverk och automation? Vi på Telia Cygate söker en 
 **Senior nätverks- och automationskonsult** 
 som vill bli en del av vårt fantastiskateam och arbeta med några av Sveriges mest spännande IT-miljöer. 
 



  
 



 Jag heter Solveig Jagelid och leder vårt spännande konsulteam 
 **Networking & Hybrid IT i Region Öst.** 
 Nu söker jag dig som har erfarenhet av nätverkslösningar och automation – och som brinner för att skapa värde nära kund. Hos oss får du möjlighet att växa, certifiera dig och vara med på en spännande resa där innovation och kundnytta står i centrum. 
 



  
 



**Vad du kommer att göra i rollen:** 
  
 



 Som Senior nätverks- och automationskonsult blir du en nyckelperson i våra kundprojekt. Du kommer att: 
 



  
 


* **Planera och designa** 
 avancerade nätverks- och säkerhetslösningar med fokus på automation och integration.
* **Installera, konfigurera och felsöka** 
 komplexa IT-miljöer hos några av Sveriges största företag.
* **Självständigt arbete** 
  nära kund, med stort ansvar och frihet.
* **Samarbeta med experter** 
 inom nätverk, säkerhet och hybrid IT – och få insikt i de senaste teknologierna inom Cloud, Security och Automation.



  
 




  
 




  





**För att lyckas i rollen:** 
  
 



 Som person motiveras du av att skapa förändring och har en förmåga att engagera kunder såväl som dina kollegor. Du kommer särskilt till din rätt när du får ge utlopp för tankar och idéer där du använder din verksamhetsförståelse för att omsätta krav till genomförbara lösningar. Förutom det får du tillhöra en växande organisation som uppmuntrar dig på din egen utvecklingsresa; varför inte certifiera dig med oss och utforska det senaste som ex. Aruba, Fortinet, Cisco och automation. 
 



  




* Flera års erfarenhet inom 
 **nätverksteknik** 
  eller liknande.
* Djupa kunskaper inom 
 **Routing och Switching** 
 .
* Erfarenhet av 
 **automation** 
  (t.ex. Python, NetBox).
* Certifieringar inom 
 **Aruba, Cisco och/eller Fortinet** 
  – starkt meriterande.
* Flytande svenska och engelska, i både tal och skrift.



  
 



  






  
 




**Varför Telia Cygate?** 

  
 




  





**På Telia Cygate är vi inte bara experter på nätverk, säkerhet och olika slags moln – vi är också ett gäng som tycker att det ska vara kul att gå till jobbet! Som en del av Telia Company har vi styrkan att skapa verklig påverkan i stor skala, bidra till samhällsnytta och hjälpa våra kunder att navigera i digitaliseringens värld. Vi gör det alltid med värme, omtanke och ett leende. Här är det idéerna och våra olika perspektiv som gör oss starka, och tillsammans ser vi till att teknikens värld blir en plats där alla trivs – och där du hör hemma.** 




  





**Hos oss är din utveckling viktig. Vi uppmuntrar till kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling och ser till att just du och dina intressen är i fokus. Vi vet att det är människorna som utgör vårt företag, och därför värdesätter vi glädje, kreativitet och olika perspektiv i allt vi gör.** 




**Välkommen att växa tillsammans med oss, där vi gör teknik mänsklig och skapar verklig påverkan!** 
  
 



  
 



**Vad vi erbjuder** 

  
 





 När du börjar hos oss får du en fantastisk möjlighet att utvecklas, omfattande förmånspaket, möjlighet till hybridarbete och mer. Du har också chans att få bonus baserat på din prestation och Telia Cygates resultat.
 


  
 




  
 



**Låter det intressant?** 
  
 




 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan senast 
 
**2026-01-18.** 

 Rollen kan komma att stängas tidigare om vi hittar rätt kandidat – så vänta inte för länge! 
 





  
 




**Placeringsort:** 

  Solna, Stockholm 
 





  
 





 Om du går vidare i processen kommer du att kontaktas av vår 
 
**Talent Acquisition Partner** 

 . Bakgrund- och referenskontroller ingår i processen. 
 





 Vill du veta mer om rollen? 
 
 Kontakta gärna Solveig Jagelid på solveig.jagelid@cygate.se.  
 



  






  
 




  





**Lika möjligheter för alla** 

  
 





 På Telia värderar vi kompetens och utvecklingspotential. Vi främjar mångfald och ser till att varje individs behov tillgodoses, oavsett funktionsvariation, kön, ålder, nationalitet, sexuell läggning eller social bakgrund. Tillsammans skapar vi en inkluderande arbetsmiljö där din unikhet är vår styrka. 
 




  




* **Välkommen till Telia Cygate – Home of Experts**

title: System Engineer
description:
**Ønsker du å bidra til innovasjon og kritisk infrastruktur – på Svalbard?** 




 Telenor Svalbard har et viktig samfunnsoppdrag – og sørger for stabil og sikker kommunikasjon i et av verdens mest krevende og fascinerende miljøer. Nå søker vi en System Engineer som ønsker å bidra til at øygruppen forblir digitalt tilkoblet hver dag, året rundt.
 



 I avdeling for Teknologi og Innovasjon får du jobbe med moderne teknologier og bidra i prosjekter som styrker både kundeverdi, beredskap og kritisk infrastruktur. Du blir en nøkkelperson i utvikling og drift av vår teknologiplattform, med arbeidsoppgaver som spenner fra programvare og IT-sikkerhet til radioteknologi, infrastruktur og innovasjonslab. Rollen passer for deg som trigges av komplekse utfordringer, tar initiativ og ønsker å bidra til å bygge fremtidsrettede løsninger som fungerer – også under arktiske forhold.
 



 Som del av Telenor-konsernet får du et sterkt fagmiljø, gode utviklingsmuligheter og en variert arbeidshverdag med stort ansvar og påvirkningskraft.
 



**Hos oss får du en variert og spennende arbeidshverdag. Du vil blant annet:** 



* Bidra i - og til tider lede utviklingsprosjekter
* IoT, neste generasjon nødtjenester, regionale og taktiske nettverk
* Utvikle og drifte programvare i et moderne DevSecOps-miljø
* IoT tjenester, 5G Edge, AI/ML
* Bygge og videreutvikle lab- og innovasjonsplattformer
* Mobile basestasjoner (RAN) og kjernenett (Core)
* Nettverk og plattformer
* Ende-utstyr, terminaler og demo-ustyr
* Jobbe med IT-sikkerhet, beredskap og robuste løsninger
* Ha sikkerhet i fokus på alt vi gjør
* Sørge for god dokumentasjon og følge opp krav



  





**Vi ser etter deg som:** 




 Trives i en variert og tidvis kompleks arbeidshverdag og liker å jobbe bredt i teknologispekteret. Læring faller naturlig for deg, og du deler gjerne kunnskap med andre – samtidig som du ber om hjelp når det trengs. Hos oss får du tillit, frihet og gode muligheter til å utvikle deg sammen med engasjerte og dyktige kolleger.
 



 Vi ser for oss at du har:
 


* relevant utdanning innen IT, cybersikkerhet, eller tilsvarende
* minimum 5 års erfaring med nettverk og programvareutvikling – det er en fordel om du også har kjennskap til andre relevante teknologier, rammeverk eller verktøy vi bruker
* relevante kurs eller sertifiseringer innen programvareutvikling, IT-sikkerhet eller sky
* drives av kreativitet, nysgjerrighet og en sterk utforskertrang
* jobber selvstendig og strukturert, men trives også i tett samarbeid med andre
* kommuniserer godt på både norsk og engelsk



  





 Vi jobber med mange ulike teknologier, rammeverk og verktøy – og du trenger ikke kunne alt. Det viktigste for oss er at du behersker noen av dem, lærer raskt og liker å ha flere verktøy i verktøykassen. Noe av teknologien du vil møte hos oss inkluderer:
 


* **Informasjonssikkerhet:** 
 ISO 27000
* **Mobil og radio:** 
 4G, 5G, LPWAN, kjernenett og terminaler
* **Programmering** 
 : C, C#, Python, Node m.m.
* **Verktøy og plattformer:** 
 Git, containere (Docker/Kubernetes), SAST/DAST, observabilitet
* **Elektronikk** 
 : mikrokontrollere, strømforsyninger og labutstyr
* **Infrastruktur:** 
 public cloud og on-prem hardware
* **Nettverk:** 
 WDM, IP, MPLS, BGP, OSPF m.m.
* **AI/ML:** 
 maskinlæring, LLM og generativ AI
* **Prototyping:** 
 3D-print og andre additive metoder



  





**Hva kan vi tilby deg** 
 ?
 


* Konkurransedyktig lønn
* Boligordning etter avtale og med praktisk støtte ved flytting
* Mobiltelefon og fiber-internett
* Firmabil
* Aksjeprogram og svært gode forsikrings- og pensjonsordninger
* Tilgang til bedriftens og velforeningens hytter
* Nye og moderne lokaler



  





**Bo og jobbe på Svalbard** 




 Longyearbyen er et moderne tettsted med ca. 2600 innbyggere på 78 grader nord på øygruppen Svalbard. Det er et godt tjenestetilbud og rikt kultur- og idrettstilbud. Longyearbyen er ikke et livsløpssamfunn og det er klare rammer for hvilke offentlige tilbud som er tilgjengelige. Svalbards mektige villmark og natur gir spennende muligheter for et aktivt friluftsliv.
 



  





**Nyttig å vite:** 



* Søknadsfrist: 18.01.2026
* Nysgjerrig? Ta kontakt med rekrutterende leder Einar Jenssen Epost: einar.jenssen@telenor.no eller Tlf. 97116647
* Arbeidssted: Longyearbyen, Svalbard
* Vi utfører bakgrunnssjekk av relevante kandidater via Semac AS
* Stillingen krever sikkerhetsklarering og forutsetter at du som søker blir klarert til HEMMELIG av norske myndigheter, så et eventuelt tilbud vil gis med dette forbeholdet



  





***Telenor Svalbard AS***
*er heleid av Telenor Norge og er lokalisert i Longyearbyen og har ansvaret for alle Telenors aktiviteter på Svalbard. Det gjelder også drift av fiberkabelen til fastlandet. Selskapet har bygget ut fibernett til alle kundene i Longyearbyen, hvor vi leverer TV, internett og mobilnett, noe som gjør Longyearbyen til et moderne og fremtidsrettet samfunn. I tillegg er telekommunikasjon til de andre bosetningene på Svalbard en av våre viktigste oppgaver. Telenor Svalbard jobber gjennom vår avdeling for innovasjon og teknologi også med fremtidsrettede løsninger innenfor IoT for industri- og forskningsformål.*

title: Webbutvecklare
description:
Vill du vara med och utveckla nästa generations webblösningar inom hälso- och sjukvård? Vi söker nu två engagerade och drivna webbutvecklare som vill bidra till en långsiktig satsning där modern teknik, AI och innovation används för att skapa verklig nytta för både vårdpersonal och patienter.
   

  

**Din Roll**
 I rollen som webbutvecklare hos CompuGroup Medical (CGM) blir du en del av ett team som utvecklar mjukvara för hälso- och sjukvård. Du kommer att arbeta med hela utvecklingskedjan – från arkitektur och design till implementation, testning och optimering – och ha ett nära samarbete med kollegor inom utveckling, design och projektledning.
   

  

 Teamet är baserat i Sverige men samarbetar med CGM:s internationella utvecklingsorganisation.
   

  

 Som en del av teamet bidrar du till att bygga upp en stark utvecklingsmiljö som kan leverera lösningar i takt med kundernas behov. Du får nära kontakt med både användare och experter inom hälso- och sjukvården, vilket ger en unik möjlighet att utveckla lösningar som gör verklig skillnad.
   

  

 Detta är en långsiktig satsning där kundens nytta och teknik successivt byggs ut med fler funktioner och affärer över tid.
   

  

 Har du engagemang och intresse för vårdens digitalisering – och vill arbeta i ett sammanhang där dina insatser bidrar till något större – då kan detta vara rätt roll för dig.
   

  

**Exempel På Arbetsuppgifter**
* Utveckla och underhålla webbaserade applikationer.
* Designa och implementera skalbara och effektiva lösningar.
* Delta i arkitektur- och teknikval för att säkerställa framtidssäkra lösningar.
* Genomföra testning, felsökning och optimering av applikationer.
* Hålla dig uppdaterad kring nya teknologier och best practices inom webbutveckling.


**Tekniker Vi Använder**
 React (TypeScript), Angular, React Native (TypeScript), Nginx, C#/.Net, Sonarqube, containerteknik såsom Kubernetes och Docker, samt uppsättning av devsecops för våra produkter (bygga, testa, ladda upp till artifactory etc).
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
 Vi tror att du har:
   

  

* Några års erfarenhet av webbutveckling.
* Relevant akademisk utbildning inom datavetenskap, systemutveckling eller motsvarande erfarenhet.
* Erfarenhet av RESTful API:er och integration av tredjepartstjänster.
* God problemlösningsförmåga och förmåga att arbeta både självständigt och i team.
* Förmåga och vilja att lära dig nya tekniker och programspråk.
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska.


**Meriterande, Men Inget Krav**
* Intresse för arkitekturfrågor och användarupplevelse.
* Erfarenhet av agila arbetssätt och DevSecOps-miljöer.
* Erfarenhet av HL7 FHIR


 Som person är du nyfiken, engagerad och trivs med att dela kunskap och samarbeta i team.
   

  

**Vi Erbjuder**
 Hos oss får du möjlighet att jobba tillsammans med ett engagerat team där alla arbetar mot samma mål – att bidra till en bättre och mer effektiv vård. Vi erbjuder dig:
   

  

* En dynamisk och innovativ arbetsmiljö
* Arbetsplats i moderna lokaler i Solna
* Hybrid-upplägg med möjlighet till distansarbete två dagar i veckan
* Generöst friskvårdsbidrag och en friskvårdstimme i veckan
* Tillsvidareanställning, heltid, som inleds med 6 månaders provanställning
* Kollektivavtal


**Ansökan**
 Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, så skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt. Tillträde sker enligt överenskommelse. Om du har frågor om tjänsten eller rekryteringsprocessen är du välkommen att kontakta rekryterare Karin Bogren på karin.bogren@partner.cgm.com.
   

  

**Vår Rekryteringsprocess**
 Första steget är ett kortare videosamtal med vår rekryterare där vi berättar mer om tjänsten och lär känna dig bättre. Därefter följer intervjuer med din framtida chef och kollegor samt ett kodtest eller teknisk intervju där du får visa upp din tekniska kompetens.
   

  

 Om du går vidare till slutskedet av processen kommer vi att be om referenser samt genomföra en bakgrundskontroll innan vi erbjuder dig en anställning.
   

  

*CGMs vision ”Synchronizing healthcare” genomsyrar allt vårt arbete. Vi är marknadsledande leverantör av IT-lösningar och kommunikationstjänster inom hälso- och sjukvård, social omsorg, företagshälsovård, barn- och elevhälsovård samt kliniska laboratorium i Sverige. Vår drivkraft är att göra nytta för patienten via våra e-hälsolösningar. Behovet av nya lösningar är under ständig utveckling, vilket ställer höga krav på oss som leverantör. Tillsammans med våra kunder är vi starkt engagerade i att förverkliga Sveriges e-hälsovision om att bli bäst i världen på att använda digitaliseringens och e-hälsans möjligheter.*

title: Project Manager
description:

title: DIGITAL CONTENT SPECIALIST
description:
**Digital Content Specialist**
 We are looking for a Digital Content Specialist who will transform our content into a strategic commercial asset. In this role, you will shape how customers experience our brand, discover our products, and make purchasing decisions across SAS website. Keeping content up to date is the foundation of this role. Beyond maintaining content quality, you will work at the intersection of UX, brand, SEO, and conversion optimization to ensure our content not only informs — but inspires action.
   

  

**Challenges You Will Work On**
 In this role, you will take on the challenge of transforming the content into a key driver of digital revenue across SAS’ complex, global digital ecosystem. SAS serves multiple markets and publishes in nine languages, requiring close collaboration with our translation agency to secure consistent, high-quality output. You’ll work hands-on in the CMS to manage, optimize and build landing pages, collaborating closely with IT teams — including developers, UX designers, and digital analysts — to improve performance and create seamless user journeys. You’ll work to strengthen UX, increase traffic, drive conversions, and streamline duplicated or outdated content structures.
   

  

**The Team**
 You’ll join a growing Digital Sales team within eCommerce, responsible for driving digital revenue through performance marketing, optimization of our web and app channels, SEO/SEM, and data-driven analytics. We work closely with IT, Marketing, Brand, and the wider Commercial organization to deliver aligned, high-impact initiatives. Together, we’re building a modern, efficient digital experience that supports SAS’s global commercial goals.
   

  

**To Be Successful, We Believe You Have**
* 3-5 years of experience in digital content creation, copywriting, UX and SEO.
* Strong understanding of customer journey design and conversion-focused content.
* Hands-on experience with Contentful (or other headless CMS) for managing multilingual, multi-market content.
* Ability to translate complex information into simple, engaging, and brand-aligned messaging.
* Analytical mindset with the ability to interpret data and make insights-driven decisions. Experience in Google Analytics 4.
* Collaborative approach and comfort working cross-functionally with UX, brand, marketing, and product teams.
* Prior experience in airline, travel, or international B2C industry is highly desirable.
* Excellent communication skills in English, both written and verbal.
* Self-driven and autonomous, with a proactive mindset.
* Problem-solving abilities with a solution-oriented approach.
* Flexible and quick to adapt in fast-changing environments.
* Creative and innovative, always seeking new approaches and improvements.
* Understanding of basic UX/UI principles and digital performance KPIs (e.g., CTR, CVR, bounce rate).
* Experience with A/B testing tools is a plus.


**Why SAS?**
 At SAS, we offer extensive opportunities for professional development in an international, fast-paced working environment. We are dedicated to the continuous growth of our employees. Working with us comes with a variety of benefits, including:
   

  

* Travel Perks: Enjoy discounted travel opportunities around the world with SAS.
* Health & Wellness: Access to health and wellness benefits, including a newly renovated gym with complimentary classes such as CrossFit and yoga.
* Discounts: Receive discounts from a wide range of brands, as well as on transportation to and from airports, airport shops, hotels, and car rentals.
* Work Environment: Our office location in Frösundavik offers a vibrant workspace with a restaurant, café, and easy access to outdoor activities in Hagaparken and Brunnsviken. Engage in running, tennis, outdoor gym sessions, kayaking, and stand-up paddling with equipment available free of charge.
* Convenient Commute: Benefit from a non-stop bus service connecting our office to Solna station, and commuter trains, alongside a network of cycle paths.


**Our Culture at SAS**
 At SAS, we are dedicated to caring for each other, delighting our travelers, and driving the transformation towards sustainable aviation. As a future colleague on our team, you’ll join a culture where we work collaboratively towards common goals, recognize each other's contributions, and celebrate successes. Our focus is on safe, sustainable, and punctual execution, and we are committed to protecting our planet while transforming SAS for the future. This is an empowering workplace where you can thrive, grow, and take ownership of your work. Join us at SAS and be part of shaping the future of aviation!
   

  

**Additional Information**
* Deadline for application: 19/01/2026. Please send us your CV as soon as possible, as interviews are conducted continuously, and the position may be filled before the application deadline. Note that we are not able to handle any applications that are sent by email, due to GDPR regulations.
* Desired start date: As soon as possible.
* Position: Fulltime (100%) starting with a 6-month probation period.
* This position is based in Frösundavik, Solna (Stockholm), and you will be expected to work onsite. Remote work may also be an option, depending on the agreement made with your manager.
* A background check will be conducted at the final stage of this recruitment process, as this role is security classified. If you are aware of any specific matters that may come up during this background check, we kindly ask you to be transparent about them during the recruitment process.


 Come and fly with us!
   

  

**Christmas holidays:** 
 Due to the Christmas holiday period, please note that response times may be longer than usual. We will get back to you as soon as possible.

title: Project Manager / Senior Project Manager
description:
**Surgical Science** 
 is a global organization and leading provider of medical training simulations and software solutions.
 



  





 Together with healthcare partners and customers in more than 90 countries, we enhance patient safety and healthcare outcomes through evidence-based, state-of-the-art simulation technology that improves clinical proficiency and performance — enabling safe and effective training without putting patients at risk.
 



  





 Our solutions are used by medical training centers, universities, hospitals, and the medical device industry for practice, assessment, and certification.
 



  





 With offices in Gothenburg, Stockholm, Tel Aviv, Cleveland, Wales, and China, we are a fast-growing and stable organization in a rapidly evolving world. We foster a hybrid work culture that supports onsite and remote collaboration across teams and time zones.
 



  





 Location:
 **Stockholm (Kista) office** 
 preferred, or our
 **Gothenburg** 
 office.
 



 Reporting to
 **Senior Director, Project Management (based in the US).** 




  





**Job summary** 




 We’re looking for a proactive (senior) project manager who thrives in a collaborative environment and can drive delivery across multiple software projects.
 



  




* Lead 3-5 concurrent software development projects for a key customer account with varying scopes, timelines, and budgets
* Drive projects independently from initiation through delivery with distributed development team and customer in a different timezone
* Work as part of the R&D Project Office team and contribute to unified processes, tools, and continuous improvement initiatives
* Manage stakeholder relationships including direct customer communication and cross-functional coordination with engineering, product, and business teams
* Partner with the technical lead to plan and track work, manage risks, and coordinate resources, while the technical lead owns technical decisionsa and team leadership responsibilities
* Own project budgets and cost management for delivery, ensuring financial targets are met
* Establish and maintain project governance including status reporting, risk management, and quality assurance processes



  





**Minimum requirements** 



* **4+ years of software project management experience** 
 with demonstrated progression in complexity and autonomy. Ideally more than 5 years' experience.
* Proven ability to
 **manage 3-5 projects simultaneousl** 
 y with varying timelines, scopes and budgets
* Demonstrated experience
 **leading projects and collaborating with teams and customers across different timezones**
* **Budget management experience** 
 - comfortable working with project financials and delivery costs
* Proven ability to
 **identify project risks and implement mitigation strategie** 
 s proactively
* Track record of
 **independently driving projects** 
 from initiation through delivery with minimal oversight
* **Highly self-motivated and hands-on** 
 - comfortable doing both project planning and day-to-day execution while proactively anticipating team and customer needs
* **Strong facilitation and stakeholder management skills** 
 across technical and non-technical audiences
* **Ability to travel** 
 to customer or team locations on occassion.
* Experience with
 **agile methodologies** 
 (Scrum, Kanban, or similar) in practice, not just theory
* Proficiency with
 **project management tools** 
 (Jira, Monday.com, Office Suite, or equivalent)
* Excellent written and verbal communication in
 **business English**



  





**It is beneficial if you also have any of the following** 



* Program management experience coordinating multiple interconnected projects
* Experience or background in technical project management, simulation technology, medical sciences or gaming
* Experience scaling PM processes or building PMO capabilities in growing organizations
* Power BI or similar reporting/analytics tools
* Technical scripting ability or comfort working closely with developers
* AI workflow automation experience (GPTs, process automation)
* PMP, CSM, or similar certifications



  





**Career path** 



* **Senior PM track:** 
 Progress to Senior Manager Project Management role managing larger, more complex programs and potentially leading other PMs. Develop advanced skills in cross-functional leadership and technical collaboration.
* **PMO leadership:** 
 Shape and scale our project management practices as the organization grows
* **Domain expertise:** 
 Build deep specialization in simulation technology and educational applications with direct customer exposure
* **International exposure:** 
 Opportunity to work with teams and customers across Europe, North America, and Asia - expanding your global project leadership experience
* **Cross-functional growth:** 
 Gain experience across our full product portfolio from concept through commercial deployment



  





**Benefits** 



* 🌍 Global environment (English as primary language)
* 💻 Hybrid work
* ⌚️ Flexible working hours
* ☕ Regular fika
* 🏩 Private healthcare
* 💚 Wellness allowance (Friskvårdsbidrag)
* 🚲 Bike lease



  





**Surgical Science as an employer** 




 Surgical Science is a global and continuously expanding organization. You Will be part of a dynamic, creative environment where we make sure to make room for all employees to influence and contribute with their own unique experiences and knowledge.
 



 Guided by our core values —
 **curiosity, respect,** 
 and
 **perseverance** 
 — we strive to empower our people by recognizing their strengths, supporting their growth, and creating opportunities to make a real impact.
 



 We invite you to join us on this exciting and meaningful journey — to shape the future of medical training and improve care for patients around the world.
 



  





**Apply today!** 




 If you think you would fit our awesome team and enjoy our work environment, apply as soon as possible as recruitment is ongoing. Let us meet and figure out together whether we are a match! We kindly request that you apply with a
 **resume in English.**

title: Penetration Tester
description:
At HiQ, every challenge is an invitation to explore new possibilities. We’re looking for someone who thrives on the thrill of discovery, who sees every system as a puzzle waiting to be solved, and who finds energy in the pursuit of safer, smarter digital solutions.
   

  

 As part of our Pentest team, you’ll be at the heart of our mission to build secure applications and environments for some of the most exciting organizations in the Nordics. Your days will be filled with hands-on penetration testing, creative problem-solving, and the freedom to dive deep into the latest tools and techniques. Whether you’re orchestrating a Red Team engagement or probing the intricacies of cloud security, you’ll have the autonomy to shape your own approach, while always knowing that a team of passionate experts has your back.
   

  

 You’ll work with Burp Suite, Nmap, Wireshark, and a host of other tools, sometimes in the cloud, sometimes on-prem, always at the cutting edge. Your experience with Active Directory and scripting will come to life as you navigate complex environments, uncover vulnerabilities, and help our clients see their systems through a new lens. If you’ve cracked hashes, explored mobile app security, or sharpened your skills in CTFs, you’ll find plenty of opportunities to push your expertise even further.
   

  

 What You Bring
   

  

* At least 3 years of hands-on experience as a penetration tester or Red Teamer
* Proficiency with tools such as Burp Suite, Nmap, and Wireshark
* Solid experience working with Active Directory
* Familiarity with cloud environments
* Scripting abilities that help you automate and innovate
* Relevant education or certifications (such as OSCP, OSCE, AWS/Azure Security)
* Strong communication skills: able to document and explain vulnerabilities clearly


**Bonus Skills**
* Experience with hash cracking
* Knowledge of mobile application security
* Deeper expertise in cloud security
* Networking know-how
* Capture the Flag participation
* Insights into computer forensics


 Here, learning is woven into the fabric of every project. Whether you’re pursuing new certifications, experimenting with the latest exploits, or sharing insights with colleagues, you’ll find endless room to grow. We celebrate curiosity and initiative, if you spot an opportunity to make something better, you’ll have the freedom and support to make it happen.
   

  

 You’ll be trusted to run penetration tests independently, but you’ll never be alone. Collaboration is second nature here: ideas bounce, knowledge flows, and everyone’s voice matters. You’ll document your findings with clarity, communicate risks with empathy, and help guide clients toward stronger, more resilient solutions.
   

  

 If you’re ready to join a team where your passion for security is matched only by your drive to learn and create, we’d love to meet you.
   

  

 Ready to take the next step? Apply now and let’s build something extraordinary together.
   

  

 For this role, we require Swedish citizenship, as HiQ undertakes security-classified assignments that may require Swedish citizenship.

title: Solutions Architect & Information Security Specialist
description:
**Introduction & Summary:** 
 emagine is seeking an experienced
 **Solutions Architect** 
 to support the
 **SECIM (Security Classified Management)** 
 initiative, which focuses on managing
 **classified documentation** 
 within construction projects. The ideal candidate will possess robust skills in
 **solution architecture, information modeling, and information security** 
 , ensuring exemplary alignment with business objectives and security protocols.
   

  

**Main Responsibilities:**
* Deliver solution architecture documentation across process, information, application, and infrastructure dimensions.
* Lead and support solution design activities within project teams, ensuring high standards and collaborative cooperation.
* Analyze and map information flows and system interactions within complex IT ecosystems.
* Design solutions applying a Minimum Viable Product (MVP) strategy where applicable.
* Ensure compliance with established architecture principles and guidelines (e.g., integration, security, master data).
* Collaborate with information security specialists on information classification and the application of ISO/IEC 27000 controls.
* Engage in architecture forums and contribute to solution architecture practice development.


**Key Requirements:**
* Several years of experience in solution architecture and IT development, ideally in large and complex organizations.
* Strong competency in information modeling and data principles.
* Documented experience with ArchiMate modeling utilizing Sparx Enterprise Architect (mandatory).
* Proven proficiency in information security, particularly regarding ISO/IEC 27000-based controls and classifications.
* Ability to assume a technical leadership role amidst complex scenarios.
* Excellent communication skills, with the ability to convey technical subjects in a business-relevant context.
* Fluency in Swedish and English, both spoken and written.


**Nice to Have:**
* Experience in the construction industry.
* Knowledge of solution architecture from design through to implementation.
* A background in software development.
* Familiarity with integrations, multi-system landscapes, and IT governance.
* Skills in workshop facilitation and stakeholder engagement.
* Experience with cloud platforms, particularly Microsoft Azure.


**Other Details:**
* Duration: Initially 6 months (with a possibility of extension).
* Location: Can be based in Stockholm or Gothenburg, interacting closely with stakeholders primarily in Stockholm.
* Travel: Occasional travel may be required within the Nordic region.
* Security: A background check will be carried out.


**Start: ASAP**

title: Business Analyst within eHealth
description:
*Cambio is one of the Nordics' leading suppliers in e-health with a comprehensive offering for the entire health and care chain. Our e-health solutions supports health care professionals in their daily work and offer patients safer and more easily accessible care. We are proud to be an important part of Swedish healthcare. We are growing continuously and now have about 1000 employees in several countries.*
**The position**
 As a Business Analyst, you will be a part of one or several agile development teams including developers and testers. You will also collaborate closely with product owner(s), other business analysts, informaticians, architects and UX designers. You will investigate and analyze needs, detail requirements, and design solutions for one of Sweden’s leading healthcare journal systems. You are an important link between the developers and the customer, with the mission to understand the needs of our end users and translate them into technical solutions. You often get to follow an initiative all the way from pre-study to development and implementation at the customer's premises. As part of our team, you will do meaningful work where you help to improve and digitize healthcare processes.
   

  

 We are currently looking for Business Analysts who will be working with one of our areas such as e.g. Order Management, Care plans and Regulatory requirements. You will be working with creating both functional and non-functional requirements.
   

  

 At Cambio, we encourage taking initiatives that contribute to the development of the company and ourselves. For us, it is important that you should have the opportunity to grow, both as a person and as an employee. Our culture is described through the words “Trust”, “Care” and “Together” which permeate everything we do.
   

  

**About You**
 You work independently and with your own drive, but also thrive when you get the opportunity to collaborate with your teammates, other Business Analysts, as well as other roles across the organization. You like to meet our customers, partners and eHealth organizations and are passionate about finding the best solutions. We believe that you are analytical, well-structured and with strong cooperation skills.
   

  

**Requirements** 
  

  

* Minimum 3 years of working with business analysis, requirement analysis, product design or similar.
* Great knowledge in how business needs can be translated into software requirements.
* Great ability to collaborate with product owner(s), architects, system developers and UX designers.
* Communicates fluently in English and Swedish.


**It's a bonus if you have**
* Experience of health informatics, and/or integration work (e.g. API design).
* Knowledge of healthcare standards and specifications (FHIR, HL7v2, RIVTA, OpenEHR, SNOMED CT)
* Previously worked within healthcare
* Experience of COSMIC and related integration solutions
* Experience in working with agile software development
* Experience in UX design


**Place of employment** 
 : Linköping or Stockholm
   

  

**Scope** 
 : Full-time, hybrid work model (three days per week in-office)
   

  

**Form of employment:** 
 Permanent employment, 6 months trial period
   

  

 We review applications and conduct interviews on a rolling basis, so we encourage you to apply as soon as possible via the link.
   

  

**We look forward to receiving your application!**
**CAMBIO- FOR A HEALTHIER TOMORROW**
 Welcome to a company where healthcare is improved every day. Here you will work with leading technology in a collaborative, trusting and empowering environment where your contribution will be appreciated and celebrated. In our caring culture you will have the opportunity to pursue different paths of professional growth. Seize the opportunity to do the most important work of your life
 **.** 
 Read more about us
 **here!**
**A healthier tomorrow also means taking care of those who make it possible -** 
 explore our employee benefits
   

  

 Learn more about our recruitment process here.
   

  

 Are you interested in Cambio but you don’t feel that this position is the perfect match? Check out our other open positions at our career site.
   

  

 Cambio Healthcare Systems is Sweden’s leading suppliers of healthcare information systems and a growing player in the European market with just over 100,000 users across general and university hospitals, specialist units and outpatient units. Through the use of our integrated solutions, our customers provide services to 4 million patients.

title: SAP Enterprise Architect - Stockholm
description:
**About Justera Group**
 Justera Group AB is a leading Swedish IT consulting firm with great experience specializing in building high-performing technology teams and delivering end-to-end IT solutions. Led by dynamic female executives, Justera Group focuses on helping businesses harness the power of digital technologies to continuously evolve in today’s rapidly changing economy. The company has deep expertise in IT consultancy, software development, and recruitment services, providing clients with purpose-driven, well-trained consultants who consistently deliver efficient and effective results. Justera Group manages the entire talent lifecycle, from hiring to ongoing management, ensuring the right fit for each project on time and within budget. With their strong commitment to quality, collaboration, and client success, Justera Group is a trusted partner for technology innovation across Sweden.
   

  

**About the Role:**
 We are seeking four experienced
 **SAP Enterprise Architects** 
 to join a SAP S/4HANA program. The role focuses on designing, analyzing, and delivering enterprise-level solutions across multiple domains while driving business and technical transformation initiatives.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Conduct business capability and process impact analysis.
* Perform technical and architectural assessments to define target architecture.
* Deliver comprehensive architecture artifacts, including:
* Business and process architecture
* Logical and functional architecture
* Information and data architecture
* Application and integration architecture
* Identify critical enablers to support solution design and delivery.
* Manage stakeholders across business and delivery functions.
* Support the program in sequencing delivery in alignment with the delivery office and key projects.
* Specialized FTC Architect Roles:
* Information, Data & AI Architect – SAP BDC, MDG, and related architecture.
* SAP S/4 Architect – SAP Warehouse and Transport Management.
* Finance Architect – SAP S/4 Finance and surrounding solutions.
* Sales & Supply Architect – SAP S/4 with domain knowledge in Sales & Supply chain.


**Requirements:**
* Previous experience as an Enterprise/Solution Architect or in technical consulting.
* Functional domain expertise in one or more of: Finance, Sales, Supply, Logistics.
* Strong stakeholder management and ability to work in large projects within a collaborative team model.
* Proven track record in business and technical transformation initiatives.
* Technical expertise with SAP: S/4, Warehouse, Transport, BDC, Gateway, SLT, MDG, BTP services, Integration.
* Ability to design target architecture at both enterprise and program levels.
* Cloud or SAP-related certifications are a plus.
* Required Technical Skills
* SAP BDC
* Technical Architecture
* Business Process Analysis
* SAP Warehouse Management
* Integration Architecture
* SAP Transport Management
* SAP BTP Service
* SAP MDG
* SAP S/4HANA


**What We Offer:**
* A dynamic and innovative workplace driving advancements in cutting-edge robotic technologies
* The opportunity to collaborate with talented cross-functional teams on meaningful and impactful projects
* Competitive compensation and comprehensive benefits package
* A supportive culture that fosters continuous learning, growth, and professional development
* Flexible hybrid working model for an optimal work-life balance
* 25 days of annual leave to recharge and relax
* An annual wellness allowance of 3,500 SEK to support your health and wellbeing

title: Kategoriansvarig för IT
description:
**Nu söker vi en kategoriansvarig för IT**
 Hos oss handlar IT inte bara om teknik, det handlar om att skapa effektiva system och tjänster som gör vardagen enklare för hundratusentals människor. För att lyckas med det söker vi dig som vill ta ansvar för att utveckla och optimera inköpen inom IT och därmed påverka digitalisering och innovation inom fastighetsbranschen.
   

  

 Som kategoriansvarig för IT på Riksbyggen får du en nyckelroll på koncernnivå. Du blir en del av ett kompetent team med 11 kollegor och rapporterar direkt till Inköpschefen. I din roll ansvarar du för avtal, leverantörer, varor, tjänster och processer inom din kategori och du driver tvärfunktionella projekt som skapar värde och utveckling i hela organisationen och för våra kunder.
   

  

**Hos oss gör du skillnad**
 Vi söker en engagerad och erfaren inköpsprofil med fokus på IT som skapar resultat och kan arbeta obehindrat både övergripande och med detaljer. Du tar stort ansvar och har en professionell, affärsmässig inställning vid upphandlingar och i relation med företagets interna och externa intressenter.
   

  

 Tjänsten som kategoriansvarig för IT innebär bland annat att du arbetar med att;
   

  

* Utveckla Riksbyggens kategoriarbete inom IT bland annat genom att arbeta nära leverantörer och interna stakeholders, vilket ger en bred kontaktyta och strategiskt ansvar.
* Identifiera potentiella kategoriprojekt och därefter prioritera, initiera och genomföra årliga upphandlingar och andra förbättringsprojekt, samt ta fram besparingsmål för beslutade aktiviteter
* Ansvar för avtal och leverantörsbas inom kategorin med stort fokus på att identifiera och hantera risker både internt och externt
* Vidareutveckla och förbättra inköpsprocessen och i detta arbete stärka relationerna med interna uppdragsgivare


**Vem är du?**
 Vi ser gärna att du har erfarenhet av projektledning med fokus på tvärfunktionella grupper och att du är van att driva IT-upphandlingar.
   

  

 Du är bra på att lyssna och förstå interna uppdragsgivares behovs, samarbetsinriktad och proaktiv med förmåga att självständigt planera, leda och genomföra dina arbetsuppgifter i tid. Det är av stor vikt för oss att din kommunikativa och pedagogiska förmåga är mycket välutvecklad, vilket visar sig i ditt sätt att bygga relationer med medarbetare och leverantörer.
   

  

 Du kommer att ha ett nära samarbete med verksamheten, IT-funktionen och juridik, där din förmåga att skapa goda relationer är avgörande.
   

  

**Vi söker dig som har:**
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet från liknande befattning i en större tvärfunktionell organisation
* God kompetens inom avtal, avtalsskrivningar och systemkunskap.
* Samarbetsinriktad och kunna hantera flera gränssnitt mot olika projekt och funktioner, samt all beroenden som finns och alla system som berörs dvs förstå komplexiteten som följer med en upphandling av IT-lösningar.
* Relevant akademisk utbildning.
* Behärska svenska och engelska flytande i tal och skrift.


**Vårt erbjudande**
 Vi hälsar dig välkommen till en förändringsresa inom Inköp som vi nu befinner oss på. Vi arbetar med både stora och små förändringsprojekt. Du kommer bli en viktig del av ett team på 11 person med olika kunskaper och ansvarsområden. Du blir en betydelsefull person för att utveckla våra IT-upphandlingar, där din IT-kunskap och ditt affärsmässiga engagemang spelar en avgörande roll.
   

  

 Du kommer att ha din arbetsplats i Riksbyggens moderna och ljusa kontor på Kungsbron i centrala Stockholm – med utsikt över takåsarna och med direkt närhet till alla kommunikationsvägar, bara ett stenkast från T-centralen. Det finns även möjlighet att arbeta i en hybridlösning. Du erbjuds friskvårdsbidrag, ersättning för läkarbesök samt möjlighet att ta del av Rikskort – ett förmånskort som kan användas i butiker och på restauranger.
   

  

 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning där provanställning tillämpas. Riksbyggen ser mångfald som en styrka och strävar efter att skapa en inkluderande arbetsmiljö.
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Din ansökan skickar du till oss via www.riksbyggen.se under Om oss - Lediga jobb senast den 14 januari 2026. Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande – vänta inte! Vänligen respektera att vi inte behandlar ansökningar via email.
   

  

**Kontakt**
 Önskas mer information om tjänsten är du varmt välkommen att ta en kontakt med inköpschef Åsa Stenström på asa.stenstrom@riksbyggen.se / 08-6984129
   

  

**Övrigt** 
 Som anställd på Riksbyggen förväntas du också vara ledamot i någon/några bostadsrättsföreningar, i de fall du har ledamotsuppdrag så utgår ett ansvarsarvode. Klicka HÄR om du är nyfiken på Riksbyggen. Till rekryteringskonsulter, annonssäljare etc. Vi har redan beslutat vilka vi samarbetar med vid rekryteringar samt var vi vill synas. Vi undanber oss därför kontakt från försäljare i dessa frågor.

title: Lead Solutions Architect
description:
REQ# FEQ326R286
   

  

 You will be the domain expert for Banking and Insurance (FSI) within
   

  

 Databricks Nordics, working in coordination with the Industry Leads
   

  

 within Databricks. In this role, you will set the vision, build
   

  

 executive relationships with customers and partners, and work with a
   

  

 cross-functional team across Databricks within the Nordics. You must have
   

  

 a passion for how Data + AI will transform the FSI industry, be
   

  

 familiar with the unique challenges that global FSI companies face,
   

  

 and be effective at articulating your vision to audiences big and
   

  

 small.
   

  

 As a Trusted Technology Leader for our customer in the Banking and
   

  

 Insurance (FSI) vertical, you provide technology guidance and
   

  

 orchestrate the interaction between customer and Databricks resources
   

  

 to drive new opportunities, demand generation, digital transformation,
   

  

 and the mapping of industry/business scenarios to Databricks
   

  

 solutions. You ensure that Databricks is perceived as a technology
   

  

 leader & that our solutions (end-to-end) provide added value compared
   

  

 to the competition by being a trusted advisor to key decision-makers
   

  

 at the CxO level.
   

  

 At Databricks, our core values are at the heart of everything we do;
   

  

 creating a culture of proactiveness and a customer-centric mindset
   

  

 guides us to create a unified platform that makes data science and
   

  

 analytics accessible to everyone. We aim to inspire our customers to
   

  

 make informed decisions that push their business forward. We provide a
   

  

 user-friendly and intuitive platform that makes it easy to turn
   

  

 insights into action and fosters a culture of creativity,
   

  

 experimentation, and continuous improvement. You will be an essential
   

  

 part of this mission, using your technical expertise to demonstrate
   

  

 how our Lakehouse Platform can help customers solve their complex data
   

  

 challenges. You'll work with a collaborative, customer-focused team
   

  

 that values innovation and creativity, using your skills to create
   

  

 customised solutions to help our customers achieve their goals and
   

  

 guide their businesses forward. Join us in our quest to change how
   

  

 people work with data and make a better world!
   

  

 Reporting to the Manager, Field Engineering.
   

  

**The Impact You Will Have**
 You will influence stakeholders at all levels through complex
   

  

 engagements with the wider cloud ecosystem and 3rd party applications,
   

  

 ensuring they are excited by the Databricks vision and solution
   

  

 strategy.
   

  

 Paired with the Strategic or Global Account executive, leveraging our
   

  

 large, multi-functional team, lead internal teams to provide analyses
   

  

 and architect solutions for the customer. Hold accountability as a
   

  

 strategic link between Databricks and the customer for identifying a
   

  

 pathway for strategic efforts and resources necessary for building a
   

  

 technology strategy.
   

  

 Technology Sales Leadership – Lead technology thought leadership and
   

  

 technology sales activities to drive the customer’s digital
   

  

 transformation vision and roadmap with Databricks. Orchestrate the
   

  

 extended team, leading customer joint envisioning sessions, to bring
   

  

 the best of Databricks technology to help the customer achieve their
   

  

 digital goals.
   

  

 Cultivate relationships - and solutions - with the partner ecosystem,
   

  

 including SIs, ISVs, and Data Collaboration partners.
   

  

 Collaborate with marketing to develop FSI content, collateral, and
   

  

 demand-generation plans.
   

  

 Digital Transformation Strategy – Own the relationship with C-level
   

  

 technology/innovation executives at the customer and build
   

  

 relationships with business leaders to achieve their business and
   

  

 technology outcomes. Understand the customer’s business goals,
   

  

 solution areas, and partner solutions to build a technology roadmap,
   

  

 enabling the customer’s innovation agenda through the utilisation of
   

  

 our technologies.
   

  

**What We Look For**
 Minimum 10 years experience working as an executive in the FSI
   

  

 vertical (directly in industry and / or deep experience working as a
   

  

 vendor to the industry)
   

  

 Intimate knowledge of the technology landscape in the FSI industry
   

  

 Comfortable across the entire value chain of FSI, including for:
   

  

**Banking**
 Customer Acquisition, Account Opening and Maintenance, Loan
   

  

 origination and Servicing, Deposit and Withdrawal Processing, Payment
   

  

 Processing, Customer Service and Support, Risk Management and
   

  

 Compliance, and/or
   

  

**Insurance**
 Risk Management and Underwriting, Claims Management, Policy Lifecycle
   

  

 Management, Finance Operations, Customer Service, Compliance and
   

  

 Regulatory Management, and Digital Transformation.
   

  

 Experience driving change at a large FSI company, with a strong
   

  

 understanding of how large FSI firms make decisions, and an ability to
   

  

 influence that decision-making process.
   

  

 Prior experience in acting as the Technology Leader for the customer
   

  

 and "go-to" person in established, long-term relationships with
   

  

 technical and/or business decision-makers at the Chief X Officer (CxO)
   

  

 level at the customer.
   

  

 Ability to innovate technical solutions to achieve customers’ business
   

  

 transformation and achieve account growth targets, by leveraging
   

  

 technology and industry knowledge to deliver digital solutions to
   

  

 accelerate the customer's digital vision.
   

  

 Proactively builds and maintains a strong knowledge of the Banking and
   

  

 Insurance (FSI) industry, associated business strategy, and key
   

  

 industry partners and solutions. Coordinate with internal/external
   

  

 industry experts to gather industry knowledge to improve outcomes for
   

  

 the customer.
   

  

 Strong knowledge of key regulations in the Banking and Insurance
   

  

 industry, with a particular focus on European regulations.
   

  

**About Databricks**
 Databricks is the data and AI company. More than 10,000 organizations worldwide — including Comcast, Condé Nast, Grammarly, and over 50% of the Fortune 500 — rely on the Databricks Data Intelligence Platform to unify and democratize data, analytics and AI. Databricks is headquartered in San Francisco, with offices around the globe and was founded by the original creators of Lakehouse, Apache Spark™, Delta Lake and MLflow. To learn more, follow Databricks on Twitter, LinkedIn and Facebook.
   

  

**Benefits**
 At Databricks, we strive to provide comprehensive benefits and perks that meet the needs of all of our employees. For specific details on the benefits offered in your region, please visit https://www.mybenefitsnow.com/databricks.
   

  

**Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion**
 At Databricks, we are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive culture where everyone can excel. We take great care to ensure that our hiring practices are inclusive and meet equal employment opportunity standards. Individuals looking for employment at Databricks are considered without regard to age, color, disability, ethnicity, family or marital status, gender identity or expression, language, national origin, physical and mental ability, political affiliation, race, religion, sexual orientation, socio-economic status, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.
   

  

**Compliance**
**If access to export-controlled technology or source code is required for performance of job duties, it is within Employer's discretion whether to apply for a U.S. government license for such positions, and Employer may decline to proceed with an applicant on this basis alone.**

title: OSS Engineer
description:
At Capgemini Engineering, the world leader in engineering services, we bring together a global team of engineers, scientists, and architects to help the world’s most innovative companies unleash their potential. From autonomous cars to life-saving robots, our digital and software technology experts think outside the box as they provide unique R&D and engineering services across all industries. Join us for a career full of opportunities. Where you can make a difference. Where no two days are the same.
   

  

**Your role**
 You will play a crucial role in designing, optimizing, and supporting Business Support Systems (BSS) and Operations Support Systems (OSS) for the telecommunications industry.
   

  

*In this role, you will play a key role in:*
* Leading the Design, Architecture, and Implementation of BSS and OSS platforms to support telecom operations.
* Ensuring Seamless Integration of BSS systems with OSS platforms
* Monitoring System performance, identifying areas for improvement, and implementing enhancements to optimize efficiency.
* Conducting Business process analysis to identify automation and optimization opportunities, aligning technical solutions with business objectives.
* Leading or participating in OSS-related projects, ensuring alignment with organizational goals.
* Coordinating with BSS/OSS vendors and service providers for system upgrades, bug fixes, and support.
* Maintaining detailed documentation of BSS-OSS configurations, procedures, and troubleshooting steps.


**Your profile**
* Strong expertise in BSS/OSS Architecture, Design, and implementation.
* Hands-on experience with Billing, CRM, Order management, Revenue assurance, and service provisioning systems.
* Proficiency in System integration, Troubleshooting, and Performance optimization.
* Familiarity with Telecom operations, Regulatory compliance, and industry best practices.


**What We Believe You Will Enjoy About Working Here**
* We recognize the significance of flexible work arrangements to provide support. Be it remote work, or flexible work hours, you will get an environment to maintain healthy work life balance.
* Our array of career growth programs and diverse professions are crafted to support you in exploring a world of opportunities.
* Exposure to cutting-edge technologies in the telecom industry, including professional certifications in telecom technologies and BSS/OSS platforms.


**Application**
 As part of our recruitment process, identity verification or background checks may occasionally be conducted.
   

  

 Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, generative AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem.

title: Devops-engineer Defence
description:
**Professional Galaxy** 
 is an IT and technology consulting company that provides highly specialized expertise in IT, software development, SAP, purchasing, electronics and mechanical design. We collaborate with experienced senior experts and deliver strategic value-creating expertise to some of Sweden's most complex and analytically demanding projects. Our focus is always on high quality, professionalism and clear, measurable results.
   

  

 Are you the right person for the assignment, or do you want to recommend a strong candidate? Do not hesitate to contact us.
   

  

 Feel free to apply today, selection and interviews take place on an ongoing basis.
   

  

 Professional Galaxy is looking for a
 **Devops-engineer Defence** 
 on behalf of our client
   

  

 Design and maintain efficient CI/CD pipelines for embedded C++ products. Development is done in an air gapped environment which means work is done 100% on site (not possible to work from home).
   

  

**See competence requirements and required skills for more info :**
* Many years of experience and a proven track record in development, modernization and maintenance of CI/CD and DevOps operations and automation in big SW design organizations.
* Experience in the development of embedded SW is a requirement.
* This person must be very driven and have strong communication skills, be "customer oriented" and actively reach out to the relevant stakeholders, and come up with solutions that makes a big positive impact in terms of effectiveness in our operations, and quality of our products..
* Strong DevOps and CI/CD competence in relevant technologies and tools such as Git, Jenkins, Python, Groovy, Docker, Bash, Kubernetes, Linux, etc.


 Approved security check requirement before starting date!
   

  

 Swedish Citizenship requirement
   

  

**Other Information :**
**Duration :** 
 2026-01-05 till Open
   

  

**Application Deadline** 
 : 2025-12-29
   

  

**Work Model : On-site**
 Please apply directly through our system with:
   

  

* Your updated CV
* Availability to start the assignment


 In the motivation, describe why you are suitable for this assignment - refer to previous consulting assignments, employment, education and personal qualities.
   

  

**Please note:** 
 We do not accept any applications through mail. All applications have to be sent through the portal to be valid.

title: Group IT Business Controller
description:
Scandi Standard is now looking for a Group IT Business Controller with strong financial expertise and the confidence in partnering closely with IT and senior management. In this role, you will help shape the financial governance and drive value creation for IT in an international, publicly listed group. This is a key Group-level role
 *combining strategic responsibility with hands-on involvement.* 
 You will link IT operations to financial performance, drive cost transparency and ensure IT investments support the Group’s overall objectives.
 



  





**What Scandi Standard offers you** 




 At Scandi Standard, you will join a dynamic and international organization with short decision paths and significant room for influence. The Group is continuously developing its structures, systems, and ways of working, offering a genuine opportunity to make an impact. You will work closely with senior stakeholders across IT, Finance and executive management and be part of a professional finance team with a strong focus on quality, structure and continuous improvement. The position is full-time and based at the head office in Lindhagen (Kungsholmen), Stockholm. Limited travel may occur.
 



  





**About the role** 




 As Group IT Business Controller, you are part of Group Business Control and act as a strategic and financial business partner to the CIO and IT leadership team. You have overall responsibility for the Group’s IT financial performance and play a central role in how IT costs, investments, and performance are managed and communicated at Group level. You report to the Head of Group Business Control, with a dotted line to the CIO, and work closely with executive stakeholders across the Group.
 



  





 Main responsibilities:
 



  




* Own and drive the Group IT budget, forecasting, and long-term financial planning, ensuring transparency and strong financial control.
* Analyze and consolidate IT financial performance across the Group, including variance analysis, risks and opportunities, and relevant KPIs linking cost to operational outcomes.
* Act as a strategic business partner to IT leadership, supporting and challenging budget owners and project managers in financial decisions, priorities, and business cases.
* Ensure robust cost governance for IT services, projects, and investments, including cloud and digital initiatives, while driving continuous improvements in cost efficiency and resource utilization.
* Monitor IT projects and investments, including CAPEX capitalization, financial follow-up, and preparation of decision material for steering committees and senior management.
* Contribute to month-end close, internal controls, compliance, and audit readiness for Group IT.
* Collaborate closely with Group Finance, local finance teams, and other Group functions, and contribute to Group-wide financial systems, reporting, and improvement initiatives.



  





**Qualifications** 




  




* 5–10 years of experience in business or financial controlling, preferably in IT, project-driven, or complex OPEX environments, within large or international organizations.
* Strong expertise in budgeting, forecasting, financial analysis, and governance, with solid knowledge of accounting principles and internal controls.
* Skilled in partnering with senior stakeholders and management teams.
* Strong knowledge of financial systems, Excel, ERP and consolidation tools, as well as BI tools.
* Fluency in Swedish and English is required, as communication is conducted in both languages.



  





**Personal characteristics** 




 You are confident and communicative, with the ability to challenge senior stakeholders in a constructive way. You are structured, solution-oriented, and able to turn complexity into clear insights and recommendations. You take a proactive, hands-on approach, thrive in a fast-paced international environment, and enjoy close collaboration. You value ownership and visibility in a role with high expectations and impact.
 



  





**About Scandi Standard** 




 Scandi Standard contributes to the joy of food and sustainable food production through healthy and innovative chicken products, produced in a responsible and resource-efficient way. They have a stated commitment to long-term sustainability. This is translated both at Group level and in their local brands into concrete, standardized and measurable measures. They will be an industry leader in animal welfare and have as little climate impact as possible. That is why they take responsibility for the impact on people and the environment throughout the value chain – both in our own operations and in the supplier, transport and consumer chains. Scandi Standard (SCST) is listed on Nasdaq Stockholm.
 



  





**Application** 




 Is this you? Apply today via the application button! For this recruitment, Scandi Standard is working with Gazella as a partner. For any questions, you are welcome to contact Julia Zovko (julia.zovko@gazella.se), the responsible recruiter for this role.

title: Senior Product Designer
description:
Born autonomous. Born electric.
   

  

 Since 2016, our technology has connected global communities with the things they need – and all without the emissions. We’re made up of experts in multiple fields and that’s how we’ve developed a new way to move goods. This is technology purpose-built for the industry. This is safer, cleaner, and more reliable movement.
   

  

 We are Einride and this is how we build a better future.
   

  

 Want to be part of transforming road freight – for good? Einride is showing the world a new way to move, based on the latest digital, electric and autonomous technologies. Through freight capacity as a service, we enable businesses around the world to accelerate towards their sustainability goals.
   

  

 Founded in 2016, Einride became the first company in the world to deploy a cab-less autonomous electric vehicle on a public road (Sweden, 2019). In 2022, we were the first to successfully operate such a vehicle on a US public road. Today our award-winning technology has been launched across 8 countries (and counting). Our clients are some of the world’s biggest shippers, including Fortune 500 companies. We are also operating Sweden’s largest truck dedicated public charging network and counting.
   

  

 Your mission when joining the world class design team at Einride will be to design complex B2B/Enterprise software for an entirely new ecosystem, empowering transport planners and operators to optimize and manage electric trucks and charging infrastructure.
   

  

 You will
   

  

* End-to-End Ownership: Own the design process from initial discovery and user research through to final polished UI for critical features within the platform.
* Tackle Complexity: Simplify challenging logistics problems—including transport planning, charging infrastructure, and vehicle remote monitoring—into intuitive digital tools.
* Collaborate and Ship: Work embedded in a cross-functional team with Product Managers, Engineers, and Operations experts to quickly iterate and ship high-quality, impactful products.
* Design System: Contribute to and maintain our design system to ensure coherence and scalability across all Einride touchpoints.


**We Expect You To**
* 5+ years of professional experience in Product Design, UX/UI, or Interaction Design, ideally with complex B2B/SaaS or Enterprise products.
* A strong portfolio that clearly demonstrates your ability to solve complex problems through research, iterative design, and successful execution.
* Expert proficiency with Figma and modern prototyping tools.
* Proven ability to conduct and synthesize user research, translating insights into actionable design decisions.
* Excellent communication skills to articulate design rationale to diverse technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* Bonus: Experience in logistics, supply chain, or the automotive industry.


 This is a full-time position based preferably in Stockholm. You will be part of a truly diverse, high performing team with a common passion for sustainability and making things happen in an innovative way. We recommend that you submit your application as soon as possible since selection and interviews are held continually.
   

  

 Please include a link to your
 **portfolio** 
 in your application. Applications submitted without a portfolio will not be considered.
   

  

 At Einride, we are innovators, building solutions the world has never seen before – but urgently needs. That’s why we take action, and it’s why we are always eager to be challenged. We know that our best innovations come from having a diverse mix of people, including those of different experiences, career paths, and walks of life. By coming together and sharing our perspectives openly – by disagreeing, discussing, and committing – we deliver greater impact.

title: Infrastrukturtekniker
description:
Vill du vara med och stärka Sveriges försvarsförmåga genom avancerad teknik och innovation? Vår kund söker nu ett helt IT-infrastrukturteam som vill vara nyckelspelare i arbetet med att utveckla och förvalta tekniska tjänster som är kritiska för företagets verksamhet. Din roll kommer att vara avgörande för att säkerställa tillgängligheten, säkerheten och stabiliteten i deras system och digitala tjänster.
 



  





 Som konsult på Eccera får du en trygg anställning och samlar på dig värdefull arbetslivserfarenhet på uppdrag hos våra kunder. Din konsultchef stöttar dig i din utveckling där du hela tiden fyller på med nya erfarenheter och kunskaper. En utmärkt möjlighet att göra karriär.
 



  





**Dina arbetsuppgifter** 




 Teamet som du kommer att ingå i kommer att hantera en viktig IT-infrastrukturplattform för ett av våra kunds affärsområden, vilket är avgörande för förvaltning och utveckling av tekniska tjänster. Ett betydande fokus kommer att ligga på att säkerställa tillgängligheten till systemet, vilket kräver höga standarder för säkerhet, stabilitet och noggrannhet.
 



  





 Som person förväntas du vara organiserad och van vid att ta ansvar. Du är en person som agerar och är noggrann i dina åtaganden samt strävar efter att göra ett utmärkt arbete tillsammans med ditt team. Ditt team kommer att spela en central roll i att leverera och stödja IT-tjänsterna. Det är av yttersta vikt att genomföra och dokumentera arbetet enligt etablerade rutiner och processer.
 



  





*Just nu letar vi efter:* 



* Infrastrukturtekniker inom Windows med minst 9 års erfarenhet
* Infrastrukturtekniker inom Windows med 4-8 års erfarenhet
* Infrastrukturtekniker inom Windows med 1-3 års erfarenhet
* Infrastrukturtekniker inom Linux med 4-8 års erfarenhet



  





 Tillsammans kommer ni att ansvara för och upprätthålla en IT-infrastruktur med vanliga uppgifter. Det inkluderar att leverera klient- och serverbaserade tjänster och att vara en del av drift- och supportteamet. Ni kommer också att hantera patchning och uppgradering av klient- och servermiljön, samt utveckla skript och använda automatiseringsverktyg för att effektivisera arbetsflöden. Dessutom kommer ni att delta i utvecklingen av tjänster kopplade till infrastrukturplattformen och se till att säkerhetskraven efterlevs. Aktivt deltagande i förbättringsarbeten av tekniska lösningar kommer också att vara en del av ert arbete.
 



  





**Din profil och kvalifikationer** 




*Krav, teambaserat:* 



* Erfarenhet av att hantera Windows-servermiljöer och VDI-plattformar
* Några års erfarenhet av Linux med fokus på serverdrift
* Gedigen erfarenhet av att arbeta med Redhat och CentOS
* Tidigare erfarenhet av att sätta upp nya utvecklingsmiljöer med ovanstående tekniker
* Ett genuint intresse för teknik och att hålla sig uppdaterad med de senaste utvecklingarna inom branschen



*Meriterande:* 



* Scriptningsspråk som Bash, Python eller Perl
* Kunskap inom IT- och informationssäkerhet
* Nätverksskiktet såsom TCP/IP, switching, routing och brandvägg i datacentermiljö
* Övervakningsverktyg som Nagios/op5
* Teknologier som Docker/Podman, Kubernetes, Git, Jenkins, Artifactory, PostgreSQL, Grafana, VMware
* Konfigurationshantering med verktyg som Ansible eller Puppet
* Horizon
* SCCM
* Microsofts standardprodukter såsom Active Directory, DNS, och WDS
