title: International Group Desk Agent
description:
International Group Desk är Scandics Inhouse Sales avdelning där vi hanterar alla leisure affärer för våra hotell i Sverige, Danmark, Norge och Finland.



Vi tar hand om och är med kunden hela vägen från offertförfrågan fram till deras ankomst samt följer upp och hanterar faktureringen efter avresan.



Med hög energi, bra samarbete och en riktig ”nu kör vi” anda arbetar vi för att erbjuda en bekymmersfri kundresa i världsklass och leverera bästa möjliga service till våra gäster.


**Vi behöver nu stärka upp med nya, härliga kollegor till vårt team och söker efter engagerade International Group Desk Agent som brinner för affären och service!**


**Nu söker vi efter dig som vill vara med och sälja och koordinera leisure för utvalda hotell i Sverige, Danmark, Norge och Finland.**



Leisure är ett viktigt och stort segment för Scandic och innefattar allt från mindre grupper på 10 personer till stora serier.



Du är gästens primära kontaktperson från och med att bokningen bekräftas och ansvarar för att detaljplanera hela bokningen inklusive fakturering och uppföljning av genomförandet tillsammans med kund. Du kommer även ha möjlighet att arbeta med införsäljning och offerthantering av grupper.



Du, ditt team och din Ledare jobbar nära och tillsammans med alla våra hotell i Sverige, Danmark, Norge och Finland.



Som International Group Desk Agent behöver du vara lyhörd, noggrann och ha en vilja att leverera service på högsta nivå. Du är kreativ, drivs av försäljning, har ett positivt bemötande gentemot kollegor och kunder och har lätt för att samarbeta. Vi vill att du är modig, tar initiativ samt vågar komma med nya förslag och idéer. Att du brinner för goda kundrelationer och att din kommunikativa förmåga är på topp ser vi som en självklarhet.



Du ansvarar för att din prestation medverkar till att teamet når sina mål och att kunderna upplever fantastisk service. Du och ditt team bidrar starkt till att kunderna återvänder till oss på Scandic.



Vi vill att du tar med dig din kultur och erfarenheter för att tillsammans med dina kollegor bidra till att inspirera och utveckla International Group Desk.



Att du både pratar och skriver flytande på Svenska och Engelska är ett krav. Tidigare erfarenhet av liknande arbete, Scandic och kunskaper i Opera Cloud är starkt meriterande.


Vi sitter på vårt kontor på Sveavägen och arbetstiden är fördelad mellan 08.00-17.00 på vardagar. Helger och kvällar kan förekomma.



Vi kommer att ha intervjuer löpande.



Vi tar enbart emot ansökningar via vår hemsida. Alla ansökningar kommer att behandlas löpande och tjänsten kommer tillsättas så snart som möjligt, varför vi ber dig att ansöka så snart som möjligt.



Vi ser fram emot att välkomna dig till oss på International Group Desk!


  
Pratar och skriver flytande p[ Svenska och Engelska



Kunskaper i Opera Cloud



Det här är en visstidsanställning på heltid.


Startdatum så snart som möjligt.


  
**Vi har riktigt bra förmåner**
-------------------------------

Rabatt när du äter, dricker och övernattar hos oss


Family & Friends rabatt för din familj och vänner


Rabatt hos våra partnerföretag


Pension & försäkringar enligt kollektivavtal


Friskvårdsbidrag


Utbildning och utveckling via interna plattformar


  
Vi når längre när olikheter bejakas. Hos oss får du utrymme att vara dig själv och utvecklas i den riktning du vill, med trygga villkor och schyssta avtal som grund. Ta med dig dina erfarenheter, ditt engagemang och ditt sätt att tänka till oss - bidra till en kultur där vi bryr oss på riktigt: om varandra, våra gäster och vår planet. Välkommen till Scandic.



Delar du våra värderingar?


**BE A PRO** **BE YOU** **BE CARING** **BE BOLD**

  

  

Enable "functional cookies" to watch the video


...uppmuntrar alla att göra skillnad för miljön och att det var en av våra kollegor inom housekeeping som kom på idén om ”häng-upp-handduken”.
...i Sverige blivit rankad som besöksnäringens mest attraktiva arbetsgivare två år i rad, i Visitas årliga undersökning.
... bara serverar kaffe som är ekologiskt och Fairtrade eller UTZ-certifierat.
...tack vare vårt stora miljöengagemang, blivit rankad som branschens mest hållbara arbetsgivare elva år i rad, av Sustainable Brand Index.

title: Shift Leader Front Office Scandic Malmen
description:
\*\*Välkommen till Södermalms hjärta!\*\* Scandic Malmen är hotellet som är absolut bäst på söder, här myllrar det av härliga butiker, restauranger och ett kulturliv med gäster från hela världen. Hotellets lokaler har ett respektfullt förflutet i musikhistorien med konserter från Imperiet, Depeche Mode & Duran Duran och där känslan fortfarande sitter kvar i väggarna. Malmen har lokalerna där bara fantasin sätter gränser, allt från konferenser, tv-sändning, konserter och större event hör inte till ovanligheterna och där flexibiliteten är vår styrka. Nu söker vi just dig som vill vara med att skriva vår historia. Så är du grym på att leverera service på allra hösta nivå, driva försäljning och att vara en förebild för dina kollegor? Då tycker vi att du ska ta chansen och åka med på vår resa!


**Nu söker vi en Shift Leader till Scandic Malmen.**



Oavsett varför gästen kommer till oss är det få saker som är så uppskattade som ett vänligt ansikte som hälsar välkommen. Som Shift Leader agerar du värd tillsammans med övriga teamet på hotellet och skapar en gästupplevelse i världsklass.



Under din tid hos oss kan dessa områden variera i takt med att du och affären utvecklas. Hos oss får du ta ett stort eget ansvar för att ta de beslut som krävs för att göra gästen nöjd och teamen utvecklar och förbättrar arbetssätt och service i takt med att omvärlden förändras. Vi är nämligen övertygade om att det är när du får utvecklas och bidra med all din kompetens och erfarenhet som vi överträffar gästens förväntningar. På köpet får vi kul på jobbet!



Så ta med dig dina erfarenheter, ditt engagemang och ditt sätt att tänka till oss – och bidra till en kultur där vi bryr oss på riktigt: om varandra, våra gäster och vår planet. Välkommen till Scandic!


**Vad innebär rollen som Shift Leader Front Office?**



Du som arbetar inom Front Office är ansvarig för att våra gäster får service i världsklass. Du är spindeln i nätet som ser till att gästen alltid är i fokus. Du är den som går igenom ankomstlistan och lägger tid på detaljerna. Du löser det mesta och är en stjärna på att vända en missnöjd gäst till en nöjd gäst. I ansvarsområdet ingår även administrativt arbete, säkerhetsarbete och arbete med försäljning. Arbetet i Front Office innebär att checka in och ut hotellets gäster, hälsa välkommen och ge gästen den information den behöver om sin vistelse. Du hanterar bokningar i systemet Opera Cloud och hanterar administrativa uppgifter runt gäster och säkerhet.



I rollen som Shift Leader har du, förutom att vara en del av driften, den övergripande överblicken över gästflödet och ser tillsammans med teamet till att prioritera arbetsuppgifter så att verksamheten flyter så att gästerna blir nöjda. Du leder och fördelar arbetet och hanterar bemanningen under ditt arbetspass. Vid behov får du utbilda nya medarbetare på hotellet och du avlastar också Front Office Manager med vissa administrativa arbetsuppgifter.



Hotellet har öppet dygnet runt och det är därför viktigt att du trivs med att arbeta i skift (förmiddagar, eftermiddagar och helger).


**Din kompetens**



För den här rollen krävs att du har både förmåga och vilja att arbeta med ett driftsnära ledarskap. Du är trygg i ditt ledarskap och har både integritet och säljdriv. För att passa i rollen tror vi också att du har en väl utvecklad social förmåga och är kapabel att hantera att det händer många olika saker samtidigt. Det är mycket viktigt att du kan förmedla ett gott värdskap till hotellets gäster. Du är en lyhörd och prestigelös lagspelare som tar ett stort ansvar för dina arbetsuppgifter och helhetsresultatet.



Du har också vana och kunskap i att arbeta med dator som arbetsredskap.



Eftersom arbetet till stor del består av att kommunicera med gäster är goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska en förutsättning. Talar du ytterligare ett språk är det meriterande.


**Information om tjänsten:**



Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid.


Vi tar enbart emot ansökningar via vår hemsida. Alla ansökningar kommer att behandlas löpande och tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag, varför vi ber dig att ansöka så snart som möjligt. I denna rekrytering använder vi oss av ett enklare test om service vid urvalet.



Vi ser fram emot att välkomna dig till oss på Scandic!


Ps. på vår hemsida kan du läsa mer om vår kultur, vad tjänsten innebär och om våra förmåner!


  
**Vi har riktigt bra förmåner**
-------------------------------

Rabatt när du äter, dricker och övernattar hos oss


Family & Friends rabatt för din familj och vänner


Rabatt hos våra partnerföretag


Pension & försäkringar enligt kollektivavtal


Friskvårdsbidrag


Utbildning och utveckling via interna plattformar


  
Vi når längre när olikheter bejakas. Hos oss får du utrymme att vara dig själv och utvecklas i den riktning du vill, med trygga villkor och schyssta avtal som grund. Ta med dig dina erfarenheter, ditt engagemang och ditt sätt att tänka till oss - bidra till en kultur där vi bryr oss på riktigt: om varandra, våra gäster och vår planet. Välkommen till Scandic.

title: SAP & Enterprise Solutions (Information, Data & AI / Finance / Sales / Supply / Logistics)
description:
**Company Description**  

We are a consulting company with a bunch of tech-savvy and happy people!


We love technology, we love design, and we love quality. Our diversity makes us unique and creates an inclusive and welcoming workplace where every individual is highly valued.


With us, everyone can be themselves while respecting others for who they are. We believe that when an amazing mix of people come together and share their knowledge, experiences, and ideas, we can help our clients on a completely different level.


We are looking for someone who can start immediately and wants to grow with us!


With us, you have great opportunities to make real progress in your career and the chance to take on significant responsibility.

 **Job Description**  

We are seeking experienced Architects with deep SAP and enterprise architecture expertise to join our transformative programs. You will work at the intersection of business and technology, helping define target architectures, guide solution design, and enable business and technical transformations across Finance, Sales, Supply Chain, and Logistics domains.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Conduct **business capability and business process impact analysis** across multiple functional areas.
* Perform **technical and architectural analysis**, designing **target architectures** at both enterprise and program levels.
* Develop and deliver key architectural artefacts, including:


	+ Business & Process Models
	+ Logical & Functional Architecture
	+ Information & Data Architecture
	+ Application & Integration Architecture
* Identify **critical enablers** and provide support for **solution design and delivery**.
* Manage **stakeholder expectations**, liaising with both business and delivery teams.
* Support **program-level planning (CBT)** for sequencing deliveries aligned with the delivery office and critical initiatives.
* Drive **business and technology transformation initiatives**, working autonomously and collaboratively in large-scale project teams.

**Role Specializations:**


We are looking for architects in the following domains:

* **Information, Data & AI Architecture** – Expertise in SAP BDC, MDG, Data Integration & Analytics.
* **SAP S4 / Warehouse & Transport Management Architecture** – End-to-end SAP S4 knowledge including warehouse and transport modules.
* **Finance Architecture** – Deep knowledge of Finance processes and surrounding SAP solutions.
* **Sales & Supply Chain Architecture** – SAP S4 expertise with functional understanding of Sales and Supply Chain processes.

 **Qualifications**  

* Previous experience as an **Enterprise / Solution Architect** or in **technical consulting**.
* Strong **functional domain knowledge** in Finance, Sales, Supply, or Logistics.
* Experience in **large-scale projects** with cross-functional teams.
* Ability to **self-drive** initiatives and manage multiple stakeholders.
* Exposure to **business & technology transformation programs**.
* Technical knowledge in SAP ecosystem, including:


	+ **SAP S4**, **Warehouse Management**, **Transport Management**
	+ **Data-BDC**, **Gateway**, **SLT**, **MDG**
	+ **BTP Services / Integration**
* Experience in defining **Target Architecture** at enterprise and program level.

**Preferred Certifications:**

* SAP Cloud / SAP S4 / SAP Solution Architect certification
* Enterprise Architecture certification (TOGAF, ArchiMate, or equivalent)

**Key Competencies:**

* Strong **stakeholder management** and communication skills
* Analytical and solution-oriented mindset
* Ability to create high-quality **architectural artefacts** and deliverables
* Collaborative working style in a **team-based model**

 **Additional Information** **Start date:** ASAP

**Mode of Work:** Stockholm

**Form of employment:** Full-time until further notice, we apply 6 months probationary employment.


We interview candidates on an ongoing basis, do not wait to submit your application.

title: Cloud Ops & Deploy Engineers- Tieto IndTech (m/f/d)
description:
Job Description **CloudOps and Deploy Engineers - Tieto Education**


Are you a curious and engaged Engineer that wants to make a difference for society across the Nordics? Then this is the role for you!


We are on an exciting journey, building up our own private cloud to host our Edlevo software. On this journey, we need 3 to 4 new colleagues to manage this. We are looking for skilled and enthusiastic CloudOps and Deploy Engineers to join our expanding team. We are part of the IndTech/Education business unit, delivering a SaaS solution that revolutionizes the Nordic Education sector. Our platform streamlines the daily operations of guardians, students, teachers and school administrators by offering a unified platform for documentation, communication, scheduling and administration. We are in an exhilarating phase of growth and technological transition from Virtual Machines to Containers and Kubernetes. We are seeking dynamic individuals who are enthusiastic about this change and eager to learn and grow with us.

**When joining** **Tieto** **Education as a CloudOps or Deploy Engineer:**


As an Engineer, you will be a crucial part of our CloudOps team, assisting in ensuring our SaaS solution operates seamlessly and efficiently with the correct deliverables. Your duties will include system monitoring, troubleshooting and assisting in implementing automation wherever possible and deploying our software. The ideal candidate has a strong background in running operations in a cloud environment, managing SQL Server clusters and databases, networking and security. The candidate should also have experience with CI/CD-pipelines/GitOps, Docker, Kubernetes and Azure or have a strong interest in learning these technologies. Since you also will be working with automation, experience with scripting and programming languages is a plus. And a bonus is if you have experience of working in hybrid environments.

  



**Qualifications**


We are looking to strengthen our team with two people that have a strong passion for technology and strive to continuously learn new things. The ideal candidate will also have some of the following qualifications:

 **CloudOps:**

* Bachelor’s degree in computer science, IT, or a related field.
* Experience as a CloudOps engineer or similar role in software operations.
* Understanding of databases and SQL.
* Windows and Linux Server experience.
* Experience of working with Virtual Machines.
* Security-oriented mindset and interest in various security aspects.
* Knowledge of scripting and programming languages such as PowerShell, Bash and C#.
* Familiarity with Docker, Kubernetes, Helm Charts and Azure.
* Good problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
* Fluent in English, both speaking and writing. Preferably also fluent in Swedish.

 **Deploy Engineer:**

* Experience as a Release and Deploy Engineer or similar role in software operations.
* Working with software packaging
* Understanding of databases and SQL.
* Windows Server experience.
* Security-oriented mindset and interest in various security aspects.
* Knowledge of scripting and programming languages such as PowerShell, Bash and C#.
* Good problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
* Fluent in English, both speaking and writing. Preferably also fluent in Swedish.

  

As a person, we believe you are a team player who acts and demonstrates responsibility to organize your work and solve your tasks. With our agile end-to-end development process, you will continue to both learn from, and coach your colleagues, so communication is important for us.

 **We offer**


We offer you professional growth, meaningful projects, open culture, and an outstanding work-life balance! We offer you an opportunity to create the future of a growing, fast-developing, and important sector. We believe that our organizational culture is an important part of enabling you to be successful. We provide a flexible hybrid work model as part of our culture and way of working. Finally, we also believe in curiosity and learning as a lifestyle where you need to unlearn and relearn every day as new possibilities emerge.

We look forward to your application!  

Please attach your CV or LinkedIn-profile and we will reach out to you. Interviews will be held on a continuous basis, so we encourage you to apply today. If you have any questions regarding this role, please contact hiring manager Jonas Karlsson, jonas.karlsson@tietoevry.com

  

Hope to hear from you soon!

title: Cloud Ops & Deploy Engineers- Tieto IndTech (m/f/d)
description:
Job Description **CloudOps and Deploy Engineers - Tieto Education**


Are you a curious and engaged Engineer that wants to make a difference for society across the Nordics? Then this is the role for you!


We are on an exciting journey, building up our own private cloud to host our Edlevo software. On this journey, we need 3 to 4 new colleagues to manage this. We are looking for skilled and enthusiastic CloudOps and Deploy Engineers to join our expanding team. We are part of the IndTech/Education business unit, delivering a SaaS solution that revolutionizes the Nordic Education sector. Our platform streamlines the daily operations of guardians, students, teachers and school administrators by offering a unified platform for documentation, communication, scheduling and administration. We are in an exhilarating phase of growth and technological transition from Virtual Machines to Containers and Kubernetes. We are seeking dynamic individuals who are enthusiastic about this change and eager to learn and grow with us.

**When joining** **Tieto** **Education as a CloudOps or Deploy Engineer:**


As an Engineer, you will be a crucial part of our CloudOps team, assisting in ensuring our SaaS solution operates seamlessly and efficiently with the correct deliverables. Your duties will include system monitoring, troubleshooting and assisting in implementing automation wherever possible and deploying our software. The ideal candidate has a strong background in running operations in a cloud environment, managing SQL Server clusters and databases, networking and security. The candidate should also have experience with CI/CD-pipelines/GitOps, Docker, Kubernetes and Azure or have a strong interest in learning these technologies. Since you also will be working with automation, experience with scripting and programming languages is a plus. And a bonus is if you have experience of working in hybrid environments.

  



**Qualifications**


We are looking to strengthen our team with two people that have a strong passion for technology and strive to continuously learn new things. The ideal candidate will also have some of the following qualifications:

 **CloudOps:**

* Bachelor’s degree in computer science, IT, or a related field.
* Experience as a CloudOps engineer or similar role in software operations.
* Understanding of databases and SQL.
* Windows and Linux Server experience.
* Experience of working with Virtual Machines.
* Security-oriented mindset and interest in various security aspects.
* Knowledge of scripting and programming languages such as PowerShell, Bash and C#.
* Familiarity with Docker, Kubernetes, Helm Charts and Azure.
* Good problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
* Fluent in English, both speaking and writing. Preferably also fluent in Swedish.

 **Deploy Engineer:**

* Experience as a Release and Deploy Engineer or similar role in software operations.
* Working with software packaging
* Understanding of databases and SQL.
* Windows Server experience.
* Security-oriented mindset and interest in various security aspects.
* Knowledge of scripting and programming languages such as PowerShell, Bash and C#.
* Good problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
* Fluent in English, both speaking and writing. Preferably also fluent in Swedish.

  

As a person, we believe you are a team player who acts and demonstrates responsibility to organize your work and solve your tasks. With our agile end-to-end development process, you will continue to both learn from, and coach your colleagues, so communication is important for us.

 **We offer**


We offer you professional growth, meaningful projects, open culture, and an outstanding work-life balance! We offer you an opportunity to create the future of a growing, fast-developing, and important sector. We believe that our organizational culture is an important part of enabling you to be successful. We provide a flexible hybrid work model as part of our culture and way of working. Finally, we also believe in curiosity and learning as a lifestyle where you need to unlearn and relearn every day as new possibilities emerge.

 **Did we get you inspired?**


We look forward to your application!  

Please attach your CV or LinkedIn-profile and we will reach out to you. Interviews will be held on a continuous basis, so we encourage you to apply today. If you have any questions regarding this role, please contact hiring manager Jonas Karlsson, jonas.karlsson@tietoevry.com

  

Hope to hear from you soon!

title: Compliance Officer
description:
**Grow with us**
----------------

 *Ericsson is a world-leading global provider of high-performing hardware and software solutions and services to enable its customers to capture the full value of connectivity. More than 1,000 networks in more than 180 countries use Ericsson equipment and more than 40 percent of the world's mobile traffic passes through Ericsson networks. At Ericsson, we apply our innovation to market-based solutions that empower people and society to help shape a more sustainable world.*

 **About this Opportunity:**

  

We are looking for a Compliance Officer to support Ericsson Business Areas (Cloud Services and Software, and Networks) and Group Functions. You will be part of a dynamic team that is pivotal in maintaining Ericsson’s Ethics and Compliance (E&C) Program and responsible for providing tactical advice to employees globally on anti-bribery and corruption and fraud prevention.


This opportunity will allow you to continue to develop and apply essential compliance skills and advance subject matter expertise in anti-bribery and corruption, fraud prevention and ethics. You will collaborate with the Market Area and Group Compliance teams and other functions to implement and enhance our compliance program and related initiatives. You will drive the application of critical data analytics skills to identify compliance trends and insights to be used to communicate with internal stakeholders, including senior leadership.

  

This opportunity requires a strategic thinker with strong communication and analytical skills, who is excited about continuing to develop ethics and compliance skills alongside experienced compliance colleagues. The role reports to the Head BCSS Compliance, GFLA CO BA&GF.

**What you will do**
--------------------

  

* Support the continued development of a culture of compliance, setting an example for transparency and promoting an environment where speaking up in a professional manner is encouraged.
* Help to implement initiatives to strengthen the culture of ethics and integrity, particularly relating to fraud prevention, anti-bribery and anti-corruption, and compliance with the U.S. Foreign Corrupt Practices Act.
* Assist with E&C program updates and requirements, and reporting E&C program updates.
* Support communication to management teams, the compliance organization and others as needed regarding implementation of the compliance program, including data analytics, relevant Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) in area of responsibility, and monitoring reports as requested by Group Compliance.
* Assist in the preparation, editing and maintenance of Compliance program related materials.
* Create and maintain reports for monitoring, tracking, and analysis purposes and ensure appropriate and secure retention of documents.
* Coordinate and track policy, training, and other compliance risk management initiatives.
* Work with GF and BA Compliance Officers in responding to raised compliance risk management concerns.
* Identify Compliance risks and spot issues, and work with GF and BA Compliance team to ensure appropriate systematic mitigation.
* Maintain a sound understanding of the local business activities and Ericsson business processes, and applicable laws and regulations.
* Support GF and BA compliance priorities; plan and prioritize activities based on risk on a prescribed cycle (e.g., development of annual compliance plan).
* Alongside GF colleagues, support compliance risk assessments, reviews and monitoring of implementation of remedial actions.
* Assist in performing group compliance trainings to ensure business requirements are addressed and ensure appropriate monitoring and tracking of training and awareness programs.
* Ensure effective implementation of Third Party Management (TPM) process and assist in third party reviews and due diligence.
* Assist with assessment and management of actual or potential conflicts of interest cases, gifts, entertainment and hospitality requests (GEH), and compliance consulting cases.
* Ensure the effective implementation of the policies and directives relating to reporting of violations and concerns.
* Utilize the allegations case management system and support with investigation remediations.
* Draft compliance-related reports as required by the Compliance Office and management.
**You will bring:**
-------------------

  

* Excellent project management, communication, interpersonal, leadership, coaching, and conflict resolution skills.
* Juris Doctorate or Masters in Business, Accounting or other university degree suitable for compliance.
* Fluency in English, second language desirable.
* Working experience 5+ years in compliance, legal or other relevant field (finance, audit).Working experience in compliance area, at least 3 years of anti-bribery and corruption compliance or addressing compliance topics.
* Good business knowledge/understanding and ability to analyze and distill compliance data.
* An ability and willingness to work across international time zones and to travel (where needed) up to 30%

 **As a person you are:**

  

* High level of integrity; character consistent with Ericsson values of respect, professionalism and perseverance; must be empathetic and willing to listen.
* Excellent networking ability and social skills including the ability to work collaboratively and with people at all levels of the organization.
* International experience and cultural awareness.
* Independent, goal-oriented and systematic way of working.
* Self-starter, flexible, innovative and adaptive.
* Strong project management and organizational skills and capability to handle shifting priorities. and multiple projects at one time.

 **Application**

  

Last day to apply: January 12th, 2026. We are reviewing applications on a rolling basis, so we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

 ***Preferred primary location is Stockholm, Sweden. Secondary locations: Romania, Hungary, or other EU time zone cities.***

 **What happens once you apply?**


Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.


We encourage you to consider applying to jobs where you might not meet all the criteria. We recognize that we all have transferrable skills, and we can support you with the skills that you need to develop.


Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.

**Primary country and city:** Sweden (SE) || Stockholm

**Job details:** Compliance Officer

**Job Stage:** Job Stage 8

**Primary Recruiter:** Menna Belacevic

**Hiring Manager:** Teresa Krasteva

title: SAP & Enterprise Solutions (Information, Data & AI / Finance / Sales / Supply / Logistics)
description:
**Company Description**
 We are a consulting company with a bunch of tech-savvy and happy people!
   

  

 We love technology, we love design, and we love quality. Our diversity makes us unique and creates an inclusive and welcoming workplace where every individual is highly valued.
   

  

 With us, everyone can be themselves while respecting others for who they are. We believe that when an amazing mix of people come together and share their knowledge, experiences, and ideas, we can help our clients on a completely different level.
   

  

 We are looking for someone who can start immediately and wants to grow with us!
   

  

 With us, you have great opportunities to make real progress in your career and the chance to take on significant responsibility.
   

  

**Job Description**
 We are seeking experienced Architects with deep SAP and enterprise architecture expertise to join our transformative programs. You will work at the intersection of business and technology, helping define target architectures, guide solution design, and enable business and technical transformations across Finance, Sales, Supply Chain, and Logistics domains.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Conduct business capability and business process impact analysis across multiple functional areas.
* Perform technical and architectural analysis, designing target architectures at both enterprise and program levels.
* Develop and deliver key architectural artefacts, including:
+ Business & Process Models
+ Logical & Functional Architecture
+ Information & Data Architecture
+ Application & Integration Architecture

* Identify critical enablers and provide support for solution design and delivery.
* Manage stakeholder expectations, liaising with both business and delivery teams.
* Support program-level planning (CBT) for sequencing deliveries aligned with the delivery office and critical initiatives.
* Drive business and technology transformation initiatives, working autonomously and collaboratively in large-scale project teams.


**Role Specializations:**
 We are looking for architects in the following domains:
   

  

* Information, Data & AI Architecture – Expertise in SAP BDC, MDG, Data Integration & Analytics.
* SAP S4 / Warehouse & Transport Management Architecture – End-to-end SAP S4 knowledge including warehouse and transport modules.
* Finance Architecture – Deep knowledge of Finance processes and surrounding SAP solutions.
* Sales & Supply Chain Architecture – SAP S4 expertise with functional understanding of Sales and Supply Chain processes.


 Qualifications
   

  

* Previous experience as an Enterprise / Solution Architect or in technical consulting.
* Strong functional domain knowledge in Finance, Sales, Supply, or Logistics.
* Experience in large-scale projects with cross-functional teams.
* Ability to self-drive initiatives and manage multiple stakeholders.
* Exposure to business & technology transformation programs.
* Technical knowledge in SAP ecosystem, including:
+ SAP S4, Warehouse Management, Transport Management
+ Data-BDC, Gateway, SLT, MDG
+ BTP Services / Integration

* Experience in defining Target Architecture at enterprise and program level.


**Preferred Certifications:**
* SAP Cloud / SAP S4 / SAP Solution Architect certification
* Enterprise Architecture certification (TOGAF, ArchiMate, or equivalent)


**Key Competencies:**
* Strong stakeholder management and communication skills
* Analytical and solution-oriented mindset
* Ability to create high-quality architectural artefacts and deliverables
* Collaborative working style in a team-based model


 Additional Information
   

  

**Start date:** 
 ASAP
   

  

**Mode of Work:** 
 Stockholm
   

  

**Form of employment:** 
 Full-time until further notice, we apply 6 months probationary employment.
   

  

 We interview candidates on an ongoing basis, do not wait to submit your application.

title: Head of IT Operations
description:
At NOBA, you’ll shape a modern tech environment, work with the latest cloud technologies, and play a central role in our journey. If you thrive in dynamic settings where delivery, structure and innovation go hand-in-hand - this is your next step.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As Head of IT Operations, you’ll be responsible for one of NOBA’s most critical areas - the stability, efficiency, and scalability of our tech platform. You’ll lead two teams and several specialists across infrastructure, workplace, support, incident management, applications and IT projects, ensuring that our tech foundation is robust, secure, and support our growth.
   

  

 This is a senior and hands-on leadership role where you combine operational excellence with long-term planning and strategic decision-making. You’ll work closely with leaders across Tech and the business, driving improvements, maturing processes, and accelerating our cloud journey.
   

  

**Main Responsibilities**
* Lead and develop the IT Operations organization (23 colleagues, including five direct reports), covering Infrastructure, IT Support, Application Management, IT Projects, and Incident Management.
* Mature roles, processes, workflows, and contribute to strategic decisions as part of the Product & Tech management team.
* Oversee NOBA’s cloud environments (Azure) as well as the IT Workplace (devices, tooling, identity and authentication).
* Ensure effective IT support operations and manage recurring activities such as ICT controls, access management, and formal reporting.
* Govern and drive the performance of external system providers within your domain.
* Track, report, and improve key risk, control, and performance metrics across the domain.
* Drive adoption of new technologies, including cloud capabilities, automation, and AI, to improve efficiency and delivery speed.


 Some travels is required to our Oslo or Stockholm office depending on your location.
   

  

**We’re Looking For You Who Have**
* Extensive experience in IT Operations, including infrastructure, cloud operations, IT workplace and service management - with a solid understanding of how to run critical environments where stability, compliance and speed must co-exist.
* Strong leadership experience, preferably leading leaders, with a proven ability to set direction, build trust and drive accountability.
* Background from a regulated industry such as banking, financial services, telecom, government, or similar.
* Cloud experience (Azure, AWS or GCP): you don’t need to be a hands-on specialist, but you can challenge, guide and make sound decisions.
* Fluent communication skills in Swedish or Norwegian, and English.


**It’s a Plus If You Experience In**
 Experience in organizational integrations, AI or automation initiatives, budget responsibility for large IT domains, identity & access management, workplace services, or relevant technical education.
   

  

**To thrive and perform well in the role, we believe that you need to be:**
 Structured, results-oriented and motivated by leading through others. You communicate clearly, build trust quickly and enjoy balancing operational hands-on work with long-term planning. You thrive in environments where change is constant, and you bring the resilience, drive and curiosity needed to move things forward.
   

  

**Have you heard of NOBAVERSE?**
 In our NOBAVERSE, we value openness, trust, and diversity. Here, you can influence your own development and have fun along the way to achieving our goals – all in a workplace that’s a little extra
 *bubbly* 
 ! ✨
   

  

 Read more about our employee value proposition on our careers page.
   

  

**Read more about how our recruitment process works in the** 
**FAQ** 
**.**
 We care for your privacy and, with reference to the GDPR, would like to ask you not to include any sensitive personal data in your application, for examples information about ethnic origin, political opinions, religious beliefs or information about your health.
   

  

**Read more about how we handle your personal data** 
**here** 
**.**
 If you have any questions or concerns about the position, please contact the responsible recruiter Sarah Wahlstedt Corméry at sarah.wahlstedt.cormery@nordax.se .
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application! 🙏✨

title: Lead Solutions Architect
description:
REQ# FEQ326R286
   

  

 You will be the domain expert for Banking and Insurance (FSI) within
   

  

 Databricks Nordics, working in coordination with the Industry Leads
   

  

 within Databricks. In this role, you will set the vision, build
   

  

 executive relationships with customers and partners, and work with a
   

  

 cross-functional team across Databricks within the Nordics. You must have
   

  

 a passion for how Data + AI will transform the FSI industry, be
   

  

 familiar with the unique challenges that global FSI companies face,
   

  

 and be effective at articulating your vision to audiences big and
   

  

 small.
   

  

 As a Trusted Technology Leader for our customer in the Banking and
   

  

 Insurance (FSI) vertical, you provide technology guidance and
   

  

 orchestrate the interaction between customer and Databricks resources
   

  

 to drive new opportunities, demand generation, digital transformation,
   

  

 and the mapping of industry/business scenarios to Databricks
   

  

 solutions. You ensure that Databricks is perceived as a technology
   

  

 leader & that our solutions (end-to-end) provide added value compared
   

  

 to the competition by being a trusted advisor to key decision-makers
   

  

 at the CxO level.
   

  

 At Databricks, our core values are at the heart of everything we do;
   

  

 creating a culture of proactiveness and a customer-centric mindset
   

  

 guides us to create a unified platform that makes data science and
   

  

 analytics accessible to everyone. We aim to inspire our customers to
   

  

 make informed decisions that push their business forward. We provide a
   

  

 user-friendly and intuitive platform that makes it easy to turn
   

  

 insights into action and fosters a culture of creativity,
   

  

 experimentation, and continuous improvement. You will be an essential
   

  

 part of this mission, using your technical expertise to demonstrate
   

  

 how our Lakehouse Platform can help customers solve their complex data
   

  

 challenges. You'll work with a collaborative, customer-focused team
   

  

 that values innovation and creativity, using your skills to create
   

  

 customised solutions to help our customers achieve their goals and
   

  

 guide their businesses forward. Join us in our quest to change how
   

  

 people work with data and make a better world!
   

  

 Reporting to the Manager, Field Engineering.
   

  

**The Impact You Will Have**
 You will influence stakeholders at all levels through complex
   

  

 engagements with the wider cloud ecosystem and 3rd party applications,
   

  

 ensuring they are excited by the Databricks vision and solution
   

  

 strategy.
   

  

 Paired with the Strategic or Global Account executive, leveraging our
   

  

 large, multi-functional team, lead internal teams to provide analyses
   

  

 and architect solutions for the customer. Hold accountability as a
   

  

 strategic link between Databricks and the customer for identifying a
   

  

 pathway for strategic efforts and resources necessary for building a
   

  

 technology strategy.
   

  

 Technology Sales Leadership – Lead technology thought leadership and
   

  

 technology sales activities to drive the customer’s digital
   

  

 transformation vision and roadmap with Databricks. Orchestrate the
   

  

 extended team, leading customer joint envisioning sessions, to bring
   

  

 the best of Databricks technology to help the customer achieve their
   

  

 digital goals.
   

  

 Cultivate relationships - and solutions - with the partner ecosystem,
   

  

 including SIs, ISVs, and Data Collaboration partners.
   

  

 Collaborate with marketing to develop FSI content, collateral, and
   

  

 demand-generation plans.
   

  

 Digital Transformation Strategy – Own the relationship with C-level
   

  

 technology/innovation executives at the customer and build
   

  

 relationships with business leaders to achieve their business and
   

  

 technology outcomes. Understand the customer’s business goals,
   

  

 solution areas, and partner solutions to build a technology roadmap,
   

  

 enabling the customer’s innovation agenda through the utilisation of
   

  

 our technologies.
   

  

**What We Look For**
 Minimum 10 years experience working as an executive in the FSI
   

  

 vertical (directly in industry and / or deep experience working as a
   

  

 vendor to the industry)
   

  

 Intimate knowledge of the technology landscape in the FSI industry
   

  

 Comfortable across the entire value chain of FSI, including for:
   

  

**Banking**
 Customer Acquisition, Account Opening and Maintenance, Loan
   

  

 origination and Servicing, Deposit and Withdrawal Processing, Payment
   

  

 Processing, Customer Service and Support, Risk Management and
   

  

 Compliance, and/or
   

  

**Insurance**
 Risk Management and Underwriting, Claims Management, Policy Lifecycle
   

  

 Management, Finance Operations, Customer Service, Compliance and
   

  

 Regulatory Management, and Digital Transformation.
   

  

 Experience driving change at a large FSI company, with a strong
   

  

 understanding of how large FSI firms make decisions, and an ability to
   

  

 influence that decision-making process.
   

  

 Prior experience in acting as the Technology Leader for the customer
   

  

 and "go-to" person in established, long-term relationships with
   

  

 technical and/or business decision-makers at the Chief X Officer (CxO)
   

  

 level at the customer.
   

  

 Ability to innovate technical solutions to achieve customers’ business
   

  

 transformation and achieve account growth targets, by leveraging
   

  

 technology and industry knowledge to deliver digital solutions to
   

  

 accelerate the customer's digital vision.
   

  

 Proactively builds and maintains a strong knowledge of the Banking and
   

  

 Insurance (FSI) industry, associated business strategy, and key
   

  

 industry partners and solutions. Coordinate with internal/external
   

  

 industry experts to gather industry knowledge to improve outcomes for
   

  

 the customer.
   

  

 Strong knowledge of key regulations in the Banking and Insurance
   

  

 industry, with a particular focus on European regulations.
   

  

**About Databricks**
 Databricks is the data and AI company. More than 10,000 organizations worldwide — including Comcast, Condé Nast, Grammarly, and over 50% of the Fortune 500 — rely on the Databricks Data Intelligence Platform to unify and democratize data, analytics and AI. Databricks is headquartered in San Francisco, with offices around the globe and was founded by the original creators of Lakehouse, Apache Spark™, Delta Lake and MLflow. To learn more, follow Databricks on Twitter, LinkedIn and Facebook.
   

  

**Benefits**
 At Databricks, we strive to provide comprehensive benefits and perks that meet the needs of all of our employees. For specific details on the benefits offered in your region, please visit https://www.mybenefitsnow.com/databricks.
   

  

**Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion**
 At Databricks, we are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive culture where everyone can excel. We take great care to ensure that our hiring practices are inclusive and meet equal employment opportunity standards. Individuals looking for employment at Databricks are considered without regard to age, color, disability, ethnicity, family or marital status, gender identity or expression, language, national origin, physical and mental ability, political affiliation, race, religion, sexual orientation, socio-economic status, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.
   

  

**Compliance**
**If access to export-controlled technology or source code is required for performance of job duties, it is within Employer's discretion whether to apply for a U.S. government license for such positions, and Employer may decline to proceed with an applicant on this basis alone.**

title: Data Scientist
description:
***Data Scientist***




  





**Location:** 
 Solna
 



  





**Join Coop – Together, we make Sweden's food landscape sustainable!** 




  





 Do you want to work with truly massive data volumes, build cutting-edge AI models, and make a real impact in one of Sweden’s largest retail ecosystems?
 



  





***About the position:***




 We are now looking for a Data Scientist to join our growing AI team. You will be part of a small, high-impact unit within a large organization, where your work will be visible, valued, and directly shape how we operate across Sweden. Our focus is on developing AI solutions that help Coop save time and money, improve health, and provide sustainable food for millions of customers.
 



  





 Our environment is fully cloud-based and built for experimentation and large-scale production.
 



  





 You’ll collaborate closely with data engineers/analysts and other scientists, working end-to-end, from defining business problems to deploying models in production and monitoring their impact.
 


* Build and deploy advanced ML and AI models that solve real business problems - from demand forecasting and assortment optimization to personalization and logistics.
* Translate business challenges into AI solutions that drive measurable impact.
* Work hands-on with Azure and Spark, handling massive datasets with ease.
* Collaborate closely with data engineers, analysts and business stakeholders - to ensure models are implemented and adopted successfully .
* Contribute to a culture of sharing and learning by exchanging ideas, discussing new research, and improving how we work.
* Communicate insights and technical concepts clearly, adapting your message to both technical and non-technical audiences.



  





***Who are you?***




 You are a curious and driven Data Scientist who combines strong analytical skills with a genuine desire to turn data into real business impact. With solid experience in the field, you’ve learned how to balance technical depth with practical delivery, and you know when to explore, when to iterate, and when to ship.
 



  





 You thrive in an environment where collaboration and ownership go hand in hand. At Coop, we value people who are humble yet ambitious, who bring ideas to the table, and who believe that progress happens when everyone contributes. You’re a strong communicator and someone who can explain complex concepts clearly, work closely with colleagues across disciplines, and help translate data into decisions that matter.
 



  





**Must have:** 



* Proven experience building and deploying machine learning and deep learning models in production
* Strong programming skills in Python
* Experience working in cloud-based environments (e.g. Azure, AWS, or GCP)
* Proficiency with Git and version control in collaborative settings
* Experience with deep learning frameworks such as PyTorch



  





**Nice to have** 



* Experience applying or fine-tuning LLMs for data enrichment, classification, or automation use cases
* Experience deploying models using MLOps principles
* Hands-on experience in Databricks
* Programming skills in Spark
* Exposure to large-scale datasets and distributed computing
* Interest or background in retail, e-commerce, or supply chain analytics



  





 Fluency in both spoken and written English is required, while proficiency in Swedish is a strong plus.
 



  





***What we offer you:***




 At Coop, you’ll join a company with an enormous amount of data and endless opportunities to innovate. You’ll get the freedom to experiment, the trust to take ownership, and the satisfaction of seeing your work make a difference, from how we serve our customers to how we run our business.
 



  





 We work in a hybrid model where you’ll spend around three days per week at our Solna headquarters.
 



  





**How to apply:** 




 If you have questions about this assignment, you are welcome to contact Head of AI & Business Intelligence (Jakob.Liljedahl@coop.se).
 



  





 We will perform interview continuously so please apply in English with your CV, and some words why you feel you’re a good fit for this role at Coop.
 



  





**About the company** 




**For a sustainable future together:** 




 Coop is Sweden's largest cooperative and a leading player in the grocery retail sector, with over 4 million members. We focus heavily on sustainability and work to create a greener and more just future by offering sustainable products and services.
 



  





 We believe that a diversity of perspectives and experiences is key to creating a more inclusive and successful workplace. Therefore, we welcome everyone, regardless of gender, age, background, or ethnic origin.
 



  





**Contact Person** 




 Jakob Liljedahl
 



 Jakob.Liljedahl@coop.se
